1.quote: In order to succeed, we must first believe that we can.
1.author: Nikos Kazantzakis

2.quote: Problems are not stop signs, they are guidelines.
2.author: Robert H. Schuller

3.quote: Good, better, best. Never let it rest. 'Til your good is better and your better is best.
3.author: St. Jerome

4.quote: If you can dream it, you can do it.
4.author: Walt Disney

5.quote: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
5.author: Confucius

6.quote: Always do your best. What you plant now, you will harvest later.
6.author: Og Mandino

7.quote: It always seems impossible until its done.
7.author: Nelson Mandela

8.quote: Failure will never overtake me if my determination to succeed is strong enough.
8.author: Og Mandino

9.quote: Don't watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.
9.author: Sam Levenson

10.quote: Keep your eyes on the stars, and your feet on the ground.
10.author: Theodore Roosevelt

11.quote: Life is 10% what happens to you and 90% how you react to it.
11.author: Charles R. Swindoll

12.quote: A creative man is motivated by the desire to achieve, not by the desire to beat others.
12.author: Ayn Rand

13.quote: What you do today can improve all your tomorrows.
13.author: Ralph Marston

14.quote: The will to win, the desire to succeed, the urge to reach your full potential... these are the keys that will unlock the door to personal excellence.
14.author: Confucius

15.quote: Accept the challenges so that you can feel the exhilaration of victory.
15.author: George S. Patton

16.quote: Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can.
16.author: Arthur Ashe

17.quote: Believe in yourself! Have faith in your abilities! Without a humble but reasonable confidence in your own powers you cannot be successful or happy.
17.author: Norman Vincent Peale

18.quote: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
18.author: Walt Disney

19.quote: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
19.author: Mark Twain

20.quote: With the new day comes new strength and new thoughts.
20.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

21.quote: There is only one corner of the universe you can be certain of improving, and that's your own self.
21.author: Aldous Huxley

22.quote: Begin to be now what you will be hereafter.
22.author: William James

23.quote: You can't cross the sea merely by standing and staring at the water.
23.author: Rabindranath Tagore

24.quote: We should not give up and we should not allow the problem to defeat us.
24.author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

25.quote: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
25.author: William James

26.quote: Our greatest weakness lies in giving up. The most certain way to succeed is always to try just one more time.
26.author: Thomas A. Edison

27.quote: Infuse your life with action. Don't wait for it to happen. Make it happen. Make your own future. Make your own hope. Make your own love. And whatever your beliefs, honor your creator, not by passively waiting for grace to come down from upon high, but by doing what you can to make grace happen... yourself, right now, right down here on Earth.
27.author: Bradley Whitford

28.quote: Quality is not an act, it is a habit.
28.author: Aristotle

29.quote: Beginning today, treat everyone you meet as if they were going to be dead by midnight. Extend to them all the care, kindness and understanding you can muster, and do it with no thought of any reward. Your life will never be the same again.
29.author: Og Mandino

30.quote: Be kind whenever possible. It is always possible.
30.author: Dalai Lama

32.quote: Optimism is the faith that leads to achievement. Nothing can be done without hope and confidence.
32.author: Helen Keller

33.quote: Ever tried. Ever failed. No matter. Try Again. Fail again. Fail better.
33.author: Samuel Beckett

34.quote: Well done is better than well said.
34.author: Benjamin Franklin

35.quote: Your talent is God's gift to you. What you do with it is your gift back to God.
35.author: Leo Buscaglia

36.quote: Aim for the moon. If you miss, you may hit a star.
36.author: W. Clement Stone

37.quote: Arriving at one goal is the starting point to another.
37.author: John Dewey

38.quote: Do the difficult things while they are easy and do the great things while they are small. A journey of a thousand miles must begin with a single step.
38.author: Lao Tzu

39.quote: When something is important enough, you do it even if the odds are not in your favor.
39.author: Elon Musk

40.quote: We may encounter many defeats but we must not be defeated.
40.author: Maya Angelou

41.quote: A good plan violently executed now is better than a perfect plan executed next week.
41.author: George S. Patton

42.quote: Setting goals is the first step in turning the invisible into the visible.
42.author: Tony Robbins

43.quote: The harder the conflict, the more glorious the triumph.
43.author: Thomas Paine

44.quote: Things do not happen. Things are made to happen.
44.author: John F. Kennedy

45.quote: Expect problems and eat them for breakfast.
45.author: Alfred A. Montapert

46.quote: By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail.
46.author: Benjamin Franklin

47.quote: No bird soars too high if he soars with his own wings.
47.author: William Blake

48.quote: When you reach the end of your rope, tie a knot in it and hang on.
48.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

49.quote: A goal is a dream with a deadline.
49.author: Napoleon Hill

50.quote: Without hard work, nothing grows but weeds.
50.author: Gordon B. Hinckley

51.quote: If you're going through hell, keep going.
51.author: Winston Churchill

52.quote: You are not here merely to make a living. You are here in order to enable the world to live more amply, with greater vision, with a finer spirit of hope and achievement. You are here to enrich the world, and you impoverish yourself if you forget the errand.
52.author: Woodrow Wilson

53.quote: Never give up, for that is just the place and time that the tide will turn.
53.author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

54.quote: Only I can change my life. No one can do it for me.
54.author: Carol Burnett

55.quote: The most effective way to do it, is to do it.
55.author: Amelia Earhart

56.quote: There is no passion to be found playing small - in settling for a life that is less than the one you are capable of living.
56.author: Nelson Mandela

57.quote: I attribute my success to this - I never gave or took any excuse.
57.author: Florence Nightingale

58.quote: Consult not your fears but your hopes and your dreams. Think not about your frustrations, but about your unfulfilled potential. Concern yourself not with what you tried and failed in, but with what it is still possible for you to do.
58.author: Pope John XXIII

59.quote: Go for it now. The future is promised to no one.
59.author: Wayne Dyer

60.quote: Do something wonderful, people may imitate it.
60.author: Albert Schweitzer

61.quote: I know where I'm going and I know the truth, and I don't have to be what you want me to be. I'm free to be what I want.
61.author: Muhammad Ali

62.quote: Follow your dreams, work hard, practice and persevere. Make sure you eat a variety of foods, get plenty of exercise and maintain a healthy lifestyle.
62.author: Sasha Cohen

63.quote: Be Impeccable With Your Word. Speak with integrity. Say only what you mean. Avoid using the word to speak against yourself or to gossip about others. Use the power of your word in the direction of truth and love.
63.author: Don Miguel Ruiz

64.quote: Look up at the stars and not down at your feet. Try to make sense of what you see, and wonder about what makes the universe exist. Be curious.
64.author: Stephen Hawking

65.quote: Do not wait to strike till the iron is hot; but make it hot by striking.
65.author: William Butler Yeats

66.quote: If you don't like how things are, change it! You're not a tree.
66.author: Jim Rohn

67.quote: I'd rather attempt to do something great and fail than to attempt to do nothing and succeed.
67.author: Robert H. Schuller

68.quote: Motivation is the art of getting people to do what you want them to do because they want to do it.
68.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

69.quote: Poverty was the greatest motivating factor in my life.
69.author: Jimmy Dean

70.quote: Decide what you want, decide what you are willing to exchange for it. Establish your priorities and go to work.
70.author: H. L. Hunt

71.quote: Knowing is not enough; we must apply. Willing is not enough; we must do.
71.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

72.quote: Do the one thing you think you cannot do. Fail at it. Try again. Do better the second time. The only people who never tumble are those who never mount the high wire. This is your moment. Own it.
72.author: Oprah Winfrey

73.quote: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.
73.author: Les Brown

74.quote: If you want to succeed you should strike out on new paths, rather than travel the worn paths of accepted success.
74.author: John D. Rockefeller

75.quote: Do you want to know who you are? Don't ask. Act! Action will delineate and define you.
75.author: Thomas Jefferson

76.quote: There is always room at the top.
76.author: Daniel Webster

77.quote: If you fell down yesterday, stand up today.
77.author: H. G. Wells

78.quote: Do not wait; the time will never be 'just right.' Start where you stand, and work with whatever tools you may have at your command, and better tools will be found as you go along.
78.author: George Herbert

79.quote: You simply have to put one foot in front of the other and keep going. Put blinders on and plow right ahead.
79.author: George Lucas

80.quote: What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals.
80.author: Zig Ziglar

81.quote: You need to overcome the tug of people against you as you reach for high goals.
81.author: George S. Patton

82.quote: Even if you fall on your face, you're still moving forward.
82.author: Victor Kiam

83.quote: If you don't design your own life plan, chances are you'll fall into someone else's plan. And guess what they have planned for you? Not much.
83.author: Jim Rohn

84.quote: Perseverance is failing 19 times and succeeding the 20th.
84.author: Julie Andrews

85.quote: After a storm comes a calm.
85.author: Matthew Henry

86.quote: The more we do, the more we can do.
86.author: William Hazlitt

87.quote: Set your goals high, and don't stop till you get there.
87.author: Bo Jackson

88.quote: Either I will find a way, or I will make one.
88.author: Philip Sidney

89.quote: Be miserable. Or motivate yourself. Whatever has to be done, it's always your choice.
89.author: Wayne Dyer

90.quote: There's a way to do it better - find it.
90.author: Thomas A. Edison

91.quote: One finds limits by pushing them.
91.author: Herbert Simon

92.quote: True happiness involves the full use of one's power and talents.
92.author: John W. Gardner

93.quote: Learning is the beginning of wealth. Learning is the beginning of health. Learning is the beginning of spirituality. Searching and learning is where the miracle process all begins.
93.author: Jim Rohn

94.quote: The first question which the priest and the Levite asked was: 'If I stop to help this man, what will happen to me?' But... the good Samaritan reversed the question: 'If I do not stop to help this man, what will happen to him?'
94.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

95.quote: Whatever you want in life, other people are going to want it too. Believe in yourself enough to accept the idea that you have an equal right to it.
95.author: Diane Sawyer

96.quote: Always continue the climb. It is possible for you to do whatever you choose, if you first get to know who you are and are willing to work with a power that is greater than ourselves to do it.
96.author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

97.quote: Every exit is an entry somewhere else.
97.author: Tom Stoppard

98.quote: Where there is a will, there is a way. If there is a chance in a million that you can do something, anything, to keep what you want from ending, do it. Pry the door open or, if need be, wedge your foot in that door and keep it open.
98.author: Pauline Kael

99.quote: Always desire to learn something useful.
99.author: Sophocles

100.quote: Leap, and the net will appear.
100.author: John Burroughs

101.quote: You will never win if you never begin.
101.author: Helen Rowland

103.quote: Perseverance is not a long race; it is many short races one after the other.
103.author: Walter Elliot

104.quote: The people who influence you are the people who believe in you.
104.author: Henry Drummond

105.quote: I've found that luck is quite predictable. If you want more luck, take more chances. Be more active. Show up more often.
105.author: Brian Tracy

106.quote: Motivation will almost always beat mere talent.
106.author: Norman Ralph Augustine

107.quote: Do your work with your whole heart, and you will succeed - there's so little competition.
107.author: Elbert Hubbard

108.quote: I've always tried to go a step past wherever people expected me to end up.
108.author: Beverly Sills

109.quote: Step by step and the thing is done.
109.author: Charles Atlas

110.quote: They can conquer who believe they can.
110.author: Virgil

111.quote: You can't build a reputation on what you are going to do.
111.author: Henry Ford

112.quote: Change your life today. Don't gamble on the future, act now, without delay.
112.author: Simone de Beauvoir

113.quote: The will to succeed is important, but what's more important is the will to prepare.
113.author: Bobby Knight

115.quote: The more man meditates upon good thoughts, the better will be his world and the world at large.
115.author: Confucius

116.quote: Opportunity does not knock, it presents itself when you beat down the door.
116.author: Kyle Chandler

117.quote: You must take action now that will move you towards your goals. Develop a sense of urgency in your life.
117.author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

118.quote: The hardships that I encountered in the past will help me succeed in the future.
118.author: Philip Emeagwali

119.quote: Don't give up. Don't lose hope. Don't sell out.
119.author: Christopher Reeve

120.quote: You create your opportunities by asking for them.
120.author: Shakti Gawain

121.quote: The key is to keep company only with people who uplift you, whose presence calls forth your best.
121.author: Epictetus

122.quote: I am not afraid... I was born to do this.
122.author: Joan of Arc

123.quote: I think people who are creative are the luckiest people on earth. I know that there are no shortcuts, but you must keep your faith in something Greater than You, and keep doing what you love. Do what you love, and you will find the way to get it out to the world.
123.author: Judy Collins

124.quote: Many are called but few get up.
124.author: Oliver Herford

125.quote: To be a good loser is to learn how to win.
125.author: Carl Sandburg

126.quote: You just can't beat the person who never gives up.
126.author: Babe Ruth

127.quote: You can't expect to hit the jackpot if you don't put a few nickels in the machine.
127.author: Flip Wilson

128.quote: Small deeds done are better than great deeds planned.
128.author: Peter Marshall

129.quote: Never retreat. Never explain. Get it done and let them howl.
129.author: Benjamin Jowett

130.quote: Go big or go home. Because it's true. What do you have to lose?
130.author: Eliza Dushku

131.quote: In motivating people, you've got to engage their minds and their hearts. I motivate people, I hope, by example - and perhaps by excitement, by having productive ideas to make others feel involved.
131.author: Rupert Murdoch

132.quote: Never give in and never give up.
132.author: Hubert H. Humphrey

133.quote: Wherever you are - be all there.
133.author: Jim Elliot

134.quote: If you don't ask, you don't get.
134.author: Stevie Wonder

135.quote: To be wholly devoted to some intellectual exercise is to have succeeded in life.
135.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

136.quote: We make the world we live in and shape our own environment.
136.author: Orison Swett Marden

138.quote: One may miss the mark by aiming too high as too low.
138.author: Thomas Fuller

140.quote: Either you run the day or the day runs you.
140.author: Jim Rohn

141.quote: Know or listen to those who know.
141.author: Baltasar Gracian

142.quote: I don't believe you have to be better than everybody else. I believe you have to be better than you ever thought you could be.
142.author: Ken Venturi

143.quote: We are taught you must blame your father, your sisters, your brothers, the school, the teachers - but never blame yourself. It's never your fault. But it's always your fault, because if you wanted to change you're the one who has got to change.
143.author: Katharine Hepburn

144.quote: I really believe that everyone has a talent, ability, or skill that he can mine to support himself and to succeed in life.
144.author: Dean Koontz

145.quote: March on. Do not tarry. To go forward is to move toward perfection. March on, and fear not the thorns, or the sharp stones on life's path.
145.author: Khalil Gibran

147.quote: You can never quit. Winners never quit, and quitters never win.
147.author: Ted Turner

148.quote: Pursue one great decisive aim with force and determination.
148.author: Carl von Clausewitz

149.quote: Follow your inner moonlight; don't hide the madness.
149.author: Allen Ginsberg

151.quote: Learn from the past, set vivid, detailed goals for the future, and live in the only moment of time over which you have any control: now.
151.author: Denis Waitley

152.quote: The first step toward success is taken when you refuse to be a captive of the environment in which you first find yourself.
152.author: Mark Caine

153.quote: The more things you do, the more you can do.
153.author: Lucille Ball

154.quote: Be gentle to all and stern with yourself.
154.author: Saint Teresa of Avila

156.quote: From my tribe I take nothing, I am the maker of my own fortune.
156.author: Tecumseh

157.quote: When you fail you learn from the mistakes you made and it motivates you to work even harder.
157.author: Natalie Gulbis

158.quote: You have to make it happen.
158.author: Denis Diderot

159.quote: It's always too early to quit.
159.author: Norman Vincent Peale

160.quote: The past cannot be changed. The future is yet in your power.
160.author: Unknown

161.quote: The turning point was when I hit my 30th birthday. I thought, if really want to write, it's time to start. I picked up the book How to Write a Novel in 90 Days. The author said to just write three pages a day, and I figured, I can do this. I never got past Page 3 of that book.
161.author: James Rollins

162.quote: If you ask me what I came into this life to do, I will tell you: I came to live out loud.
162.author: Emile Zola

163.quote: What is called genius is the abundance of life and health.
163.author: Henry David Thoreau

164.quote: If you've got a talent, protect it.
164.author: Jim Carrey

165.quote: The dog that trots about finds a bone.
165.author: Golda Meir

166.quote: There is nothing deep down inside us except what we have put there ourselves.
166.author: Richard Rorty

168.quote: Determine never to be idle. No person will have occasion to complain of the want of time who never loses any. It is wonderful how much may be done if we are always doing.
168.author: Thomas Jefferson

169.quote: Hitch your wagon to a star.
169.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

170.quote: Get action. Seize the moment. Man was never intended to become an oyster.
170.author: Theodore Roosevelt

171.quote: To know oneself, one should assert oneself.
171.author: Albert Camus

172.quote: It is very important to know who you are. To make decisions. To show who you are.
172.author: Malala Yousafzai

173.quote: A somebody was once a nobody who wanted to and did.
173.author: John Burroughs

174.quote: If you think you can do it, you can.
174.author: John Burroughs

175.quote: If you want to conquer fear, don't sit home and think about it. Go out and get busy.
175.author: Dale Carnegie

177.quote: Big shots are only little shots who keep shooting.
177.author: Christopher Morley

178.quote: Your heaviest artillery will be your will to live. Keep that big gun going.
178.author: Norman Cousins

179.quote: Press forward. Do not stop, do not linger in your journey, but strive for the mark set before you.
179.author: George Whitefield

180.quote: One way to keep momentum going is to have constantly greater goals.
180.author: Michael Korda

181.quote: You have to learn the rules of the game. And then you have to play better than anyone else.
181.author: Unknown

182.quote: You can't wait for inspiration. You have to go after it with a club.
182.author: Jack London

183.quote: I learned that we can do anything, but we can't do everything... at least not at the same time. So think of your priorities not in terms of what activities you do, but when you do them. Timing is everything.
183.author: Dan Millman

184.quote: Set your sights high, the higher the better. Expect the most wonderful things to happen, not in the future but right now. Realize that nothing is too good. Allow absolutely nothing to hamper you or hold you up in any way.
184.author: Eileen Caddy

185.quote: Don't fight the problem, decide it.
185.author: George C. Marshall

186.quote: I am not a has-been. I am a will be.
186.author: Lauren Bacall

187.quote: No matter how many goals you have achieved, you must set your sights on a higher one.
187.author: Jessica Savitch

188.quote: You never know what motivates you.
188.author: Cicely Tyson

189.quote: There is progress whether ye are going forward or backward! The thing is to move!
189.author: Edgar Cayce

190.quote: We aim above the mark to hit the mark.
190.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

192.quote: God always strives together with those who strive.
192.author: Aeschylus

193.quote: I know not age, nor weariness nor defeat.
193.author: Rose Kennedy

196.quote: The weeds keep multiplying in our garden, which is our mind ruled by fear. Rip them out and call them by name.
196.author: Sylvia Browne

197.quote: I've worked too hard and too long to let anything stand in the way of my goals. I will not let my teammates down and I will not let myself down.
197.author: Mia Hamm

198.quote: Be thine own palace, or the world's thy jail.
198.author: John Donne

199.quote: The wise does at once what the fool does at last.
199.author: Baltasar Gracian

200.quote: Set yourself earnestly to see what you are made to do, and then set yourself earnestly to do it.
200.author: Phillips Brooks

201.quote: Do not weep; do not wax indignant. Understand.
201.author: Baruch Spinoza

202.quote: How do you know you're going to do something, untill you do it?
202.author: J. D. Salinger

203.quote: Crave for a thing, you will get it. Renounce the craving, the object will follow you by itself.
203.author: Swami Sivananda

204.quote: The ultimate aim of the ego is not to see something, but to be something.
204.author: Muhammad Iqbal

205.quote: I was motivated to be different in part because I was different.
205.author: Donna Brazile

207.quote: We need to accept that the commandments of God aren't just a long list of good ideas. They aren't 'life hacks' from an Internet blog or motivational quotes from a Pinterest board.
207.author: Dieter F. Uchtdorf

208.quote: As long as I'm not selling out the people that ride or die with me, I'm glad I'm not an MC. I'm a motivational speaker. I'm not that rapper dude.
208.author: Young Jeezy

209.quote: Typically, if you reward something, you get more of it. You punish something, you get less of it. And our businesses have been built for the last 150 years very much on that kind of motivational scheme.
209.author: Daniel H. Pink

210.quote: Giving back, doing motivational speeches and stuff like that, that's always made me feel good. If you repeatedly go out there, and you are the change that you want to see, then that's what you are.
210.author: Keke Palmer

211.quote: Give Obama a script he has made his own, and he is the motivational speaker to end all speakers. Tony Robbins cloned with Honest Abe.
211.author: Tina Brown

212.quote: Success is the only motivational factor that a boy with character needs.
212.author: Woody Hayes

213.quote: I like to put on hardcore when I have to clean my apartment, which I hate to do, but it's motivational. I like old heavy metal when I'm outside working on my car. Music has definite functions for me.
213.author: Peter Steele

214.quote: I believe that any type of education can be great, but an education about ourselves can create something wonderful. I am a comedian, but people have called me a motivational speaker. I don't really consider myself that at all.
214.author: Andy Andrews

215.quote: I'm going to write a book, continue acting, continue motivational speaking and just share with people who I am and what I've learned in my second chance of life and pass it on to people in their first chance of life.
215.author: J. R. Martinez

216.quote: Religious speech is extreme, emotional, and motivational. It is anti-literal, relying on metaphor, allusion, and other rhetorical devices, and it assumes knowledge within a community of believers.
216.author: Amy Waldman

217.quote: I've always thought of acting as more of an exercise in empathy, which is not to be confused with sympathy. You're trying to get inside a certain emotional reality or motivational reality and try to figure out what that's about so you can represent it.
217.author: Edward Norton

218.quote: I started doing motivational tours. I've seen all kinds of people, from the CEOs to the lowest executive, opening up to their fears. We don't introspect as much as we should.
218.author: Anupam Kher

219.quote: Marvin's Motivational Moments actually started as something that was actually therapeutic for me. I would sit up late at night after my wife passed trying to adjust to being alone.
219.author: Marvin Sapp

220.quote: My first book was called, 'Mountain, Get Out of My Way,' where I did an autobiographical sketch, if you will, looking back at myself and looking back at things in my life, and juxtaposing them against things that are happening in other people's lives and trying to be motivational.
220.author: Montel Williams

221.quote: People always accuse me of being motivational in a way, like it was a bad thing, but that's just how I was raised. My mom raised me in a positive environment, with lots of love in my heart, and that reflects in my music.
221.author: Lenny Kravitz

222.quote: One of the things that I did before I ran for president is I was a professional speaker. Not a motivational speaker - an inspirational speaker. Motivation comes from within. You have to be inspired. That's what I do. I inspire people, I inspire the public, I inspire my staff. I inspired the organizations I took over to want to succeed.
222.author: Herman Cain

223.quote: I went to a motivational training course once, a course of self-discovery, and I found out after a week that my fear - it was not a fear of not being accepted - was a very violent fear of failure.
223.author: Emanuel Steward

224.quote: I want to be motivational and inspirational for everybody: my big aim is more women on bicycles.
224.author: Marianne Vos

225.quote: Oh, I would love to be a motivational speaker. I have pulled myself out of a million potholes, and I can see the potholes ahead of me. That doesn't mean that I could always do that so perfectly for my own life. I totally fall in potholes.
225.author: Drew Barrymore

226.quote: I'm thrilled to continue my partnership with U by Kotex for Generation Know while helping to empower girls. I've always been a motivational resource for my younger sisters and hope I can positively impact and inspire other young girls too.
226.author: Khloe Kardashian

227.quote: One day, I got so disgusted that I sat down and wrote a list called 'Justin's list of things to do before he kicks the bucket.' I wrote it for myself and shortened it to 'Justin's Bucket List.' It was there on the wall, not as a story idea but as a motivational tool for myself, which actually ended up working pretty well.
227.author: Justin Zackham

228.quote: I realized I love motivating and I love empowering and I love inspiring people. I did that as an athlete for 18 years, and I am able to do that as a motivational speaker now as well as doing work on television.
228.author: Dominique Dawes

229.quote: Earl Nightingale has inspired more people toward success and fortune than any other motivational speaker on the planet.
229.author: Zig Ziglar

230.quote: Our subliminal mental processes operate outside awareness because they arise in these portions of our mind that are inaccessible to our conscious self; their inaccessibility is due to the architecture of the brain rather than because they have been subject to Freudian motivational forces like repression.
230.author: Leonard Mlodinow

231.quote: I like motivational books, because I like the go-getting American spirit - your destiny is in your own hands, life is what you make it, don't accept your limitations, jump before you're pushed, leap before you look.
231.author: Louise Mensch

233.quote: I don't know what it's like to have a typical father figure. He's not the dad who's going to take me to the beach and go swimming, but he's such a motivational person.
233.author: Tiffany Trump

234.quote: The best preparation for tomorrow is doing your best today.
234.author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

235.quote: Put your heart, mind, and soul into even your smallest acts. This is the secret of success.
235.author: Swami Sivananda

236.quote: The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched - they must be felt with the heart.
236.author: Helen Keller

237.quote: As we express our gratitude, we must never forget that the highest appreciation is not to utter words, but to live by them.
237.author: John F. Kennedy

238.quote: Change your thoughts and you change your world.
238.author: Norman Vincent Peale

239.quote: Nothing is impossible, the word itself says 'I'm possible'!
239.author: Audrey Hepburn

240.quote: If opportunity doesn't knock, build a door.
240.author: Milton Berle

241.quote: Start by doing what's necessary; then do what's possible; and suddenly you are doing the impossible.
241.author: Francis of Assisi

242.quote: Keep your face always toward the sunshine - and shadows will fall behind you.
242.author: Walt Whitman

243.quote: Perfection is not attainable, but if we chase perfection we can catch excellence.
243.author: Vince Lombardi

244.quote: We know what we are, but know not what we may be.
244.author: William Shakespeare

246.quote: It is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light.
246.author: Aristotle Onassis

247.quote: I can't change the direction of the wind, but I can adjust my sails to always reach my destination.
247.author: Jimmy Dean

248.quote: Try to be a rainbow in someone's cloud.
248.author: Maya Angelou

249.quote: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
249.author: Theodore Roosevelt

250.quote: Your work is going to fill a large part of your life, and the only way to be truly satisfied is to do what you believe is great work. And the only way to do great work is to love what you do. If you haven't found it yet, keep looking. Don't settle. As with all matters of the heart, you'll know when you find it.
250.author: Steve Jobs

251.quote: Happiness is not something you postpone for the future; it is something you design for the present.
251.author: Jim Rohn

252.quote: A hero is someone who has given his or her life to something bigger than oneself.
252.author: Joseph Campbell

253.quote: My mission in life is not merely to survive, but to thrive; and to do so with some passion, some compassion, some humor, and some style.
253.author: Maya Angelou

254.quote: No act of kindness, no matter how small, is ever wasted.
254.author: Aesop

255.quote: Today I choose life. Every morning when I wake up I can choose joy, happiness, negativity, pain... To feel the freedom that comes from being able to continue to make mistakes and choices - today I choose to feel life, not to deny my humanity but embrace it.
255.author: Kevyn Aucoin

256.quote: Clouds come floating into my life, no longer to carry rain or usher storm, but to add color to my sunset sky.
256.author: Rabindranath Tagore

257.quote: If you believe in yourself and have dedication and pride - and never quit, you'll be a winner. The price of victory is high but so are the rewards.
257.author: Paul Bryant

258.quote: Health is the greatest gift, contentment the greatest wealth, faithfulness the best relationship.
258.author: Buddha

259.quote: Let us sacrifice our today so that our children can have a better tomorrow.
259.author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

260.quote: If the world seems cold to you, kindle fires to warm it.
260.author: Lucy Larcom

261.quote: There are two ways of spreading light: to be the candle or the mirror that reflects it.
261.author: Edith Wharton

262.quote: A place for everything, everything in its place.
262.author: Benjamin Franklin

263.quote: When the sun is shining I can do anything; no mountain is too high, no trouble too difficult to overcome.
263.author: Wilma Rudolph

264.quote: Thousands of candles can be lighted from a single candle, and the life of the candle will not be shortened. Happiness never decreases by being shared.
264.author: Buddha

265.quote: I believe in pink. I believe that laughing is the best calorie burner. I believe in kissing, kissing a lot. I believe in being strong when everything seems to be going wrong. I believe that happy girls are the prettiest girls. I believe that tomorrow is another day and I believe in miracles.
265.author: Audrey Hepburn

266.quote: We can't help everyone, but everyone can help someone.
266.author: Ronald Reagan

267.quote: We must let go of the life we have planned, so as to accept the one that is waiting for us.
267.author: Joseph Campbell

268.quote: It is never too late to be what you might have been.
268.author: George Eliot

269.quote: There are glimpses of heaven to us in every act, or thought, or word, that raises us above ourselves.
269.author: Robert Quillen

270.quote: I hated every minute of training, but I said, 'Don't quit. Suffer now and live the rest of your life as a champion.'
270.author: Muhammad Ali

271.quote: No matter what people tell you, words and ideas can change the world.
271.author: Robin Williams

272.quote: The measure of who we are is what we do with what we have.
272.author: Vince Lombardi

273.quote: You must do the things you think you cannot do.
273.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

274.quote: Every story I create, creates me. I write to create myself.
274.author: Octavia E. Butler

275.quote: Even if I knew that tomorrow the world would go to pieces, I would still plant my apple tree.
275.author: Martin Luther

276.quote: Don't judge each day by the harvest you reap but by the seeds that you plant.
276.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

277.quote: Let your life lightly dance on the edges of Time like dew on the tip of a leaf.
277.author: Rabindranath Tagore

278.quote: Let us remember: One book, one pen, one child, and one teacher can change the world.
278.author: Malala Yousafzai

279.quote: If I have seen further than others, it is by standing upon the shoulders of giants.
279.author: Isaac Newton

280.quote: If you always put limit on everything you do, physical or anything else. It will spread into your work and into your life. There are no limits. There are only plateaus, and you must not stay there, you must go beyond them.
280.author: Bruce Lee

281.quote: Give light, and the darkness will disappear of itself.
281.author: Desiderius Erasmus

282.quote: Shoot for the moon and if you miss you will still be among the stars.
282.author: Les Brown

283.quote: The bird is powered by its own life and by its motivation.
283.author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

284.quote: Two roads diverged in a wood and I - I took the one less traveled by, and that has made all the difference.
284.author: Robert Frost

285.quote: From a small seed a mighty trunk may grow.
285.author: Aeschylus

286.quote: God always gives His best to those who leave the choice with him.
286.author: Jim Elliot

287.quote: There is nothing impossible to him who will try.
287.author: Alexander the Great

288.quote: Don't limit yourself. Many people limit themselves to what they think they can do. You can go as far as your mind lets you. What you believe, remember, you can achieve.
288.author: Mary Kay Ash

289.quote: The limits of the possible can only be defined by going beyond them into the impossible.
289.author: Arthur C. Clarke

290.quote: What lies behind you and what lies in front of you, pales in comparison to what lies inside of you.
290.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

291.quote: Whoever is happy will make others happy too.
291.author: Anne Frank

292.quote: When you get into a tight place and everything goes against you, till it seems as though you could not hang on a minute longer, never give up then, for that is just the place and time that the tide will turn.
292.author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

293.quote: With self-discipline most anything is possible.
293.author: Theodore Roosevelt

295.quote: How wonderful it is that nobody need wait a single moment before starting to improve the world.
295.author: Anne Frank

296.quote: Memories of our lives, of our works and our deeds will continue in others.
296.author: Rosa Parks

297.quote: Tomorrow is the most important thing in life. Comes into us at midnight very clean. It's perfect when it arrives and it puts itself in our hands. It hopes we've learned something from yesterday.
297.author: John Wayne

298.quote: Everyone here has the sense that right now is one of those moments when we are influencing the future.
298.author: Steve Jobs

299.quote: The world is full of magical things patiently waiting for our wits to grow sharper.
299.author: Bertrand Russell

300.quote: What great thing would you attempt if you knew you could not fail?
300.author: Robert H. Schuller

301.quote: If we did all the things we are capable of, we would literally astound ourselves.
301.author: Thomas A. Edison

302.quote: Be brave enough to live life creatively. The creative place where no one else has ever been.
302.author: Alan Alda

303.quote: The best way out is always through.
303.author: Robert Frost

304.quote: Happiness is a butterfly, which when pursued, is always just beyond your grasp, but which, if you will sit down quietly, may alight upon you.
304.author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

305.quote: If there were no night, we would not appreciate the day, nor could we see the stars and the vastness of the heavens. We must partake of the bitter with the sweet. There is a divine purpose in the adversities we encounter every day. They prepare, they purge, they purify, and thus they bless.
305.author: James E. Faust

306.quote: Happiness resides not in possessions, and not in gold, happiness dwells in the soul.
306.author: Democritus

307.quote: The things that we love tell us what we are.
307.author: Thomas Aquinas

308.quote: Someone is sitting in the shade today because someone planted a tree a long time ago.
308.author: Warren Buffett

309.quote: Your big opportunity may be right where you are now.
309.author: Napoleon Hill

311.quote: Just don't give up trying to do what you really want to do. Where there is love and inspiration, I don't think you can go wrong.
311.author: Ella Fitzgerald

312.quote: Keep all special thoughts and memories for lifetimes to come. Share these keepsakes with others to inspire hope and build from the past, which can bridge to the future.
312.author: Mattie Stepanek

313.quote: Your heart is full of fertile seeds, waiting to sprout.
313.author: Morihei Ueshiba

314.quote: If a man does not keep pace with his companions, perhaps it is because he hears a different drummer. Let him step to the music which he hears, however measured or far away.
314.author: Henry David Thoreau

315.quote: Thought is the wind, knowledge the sail, and mankind the vessel.
315.author: Augustus Hare

316.quote: If you accept the expectations of others, especially negative ones, then you never will change the outcome.
316.author: Michael Jordan

317.quote: Of all things visible, the highest is the heaven of the fixed stars.
317.author: Nicolaus Copernicus

318.quote: Follow your bliss and the universe will open doors where there were only walls.
318.author: Joseph Campbell

319.quote: Live your beliefs and you can turn the world around.
319.author: Henry David Thoreau

320.quote: Only those who have learned the power of sincere and selfless contribution experience life's deepest joy: true fulfillment.
320.author: Tony Robbins

321.quote: Tears of joy are like the summer rain drops pierced by sunbeams.
321.author: Hosea Ballou

322.quote: Everyone has inside of him a piece of good news. The good news is that you don't know how great you can be! How much you can love! What you can accomplish! And what your potential is!
322.author: Anne Frank

323.quote: Let us dream of tomorrow where we can truly love from the soul, and know love as the ultimate truth at the heart of all creation.
323.author: Michael Jackson

324.quote: It is always the simple that produces the marvelous.
324.author: Amelia Barr

325.quote: Try to be like the turtle - at ease in your own shell.
325.author: Bill Copeland

326.quote: Accept the things to which fate binds you, and love the people with whom fate brings you together, but do so with all your heart.
326.author: Marcus Aurelius

327.quote: The power of imagination makes us infinite.
327.author: John Muir

328.quote: Man never made any material as resilient as the human spirit.
328.author: Bernard Williams

329.quote: Wonder rather than doubt is the root of all knowledge.
329.author: Abraham Joshua Heschel

330.quote: I believe every human has a finite number of heartbeats. I don't intend to waste any of mine.
330.author: Neil Armstrong

331.quote: In oneself lies the whole world and if you know how to look and learn, the door is there and the key is in your hand. Nobody on earth can give you either the key or the door to open, except yourself.
331.author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

332.quote: I will love the light for it shows me the way, yet I will endure the darkness because it shows me the stars.
332.author: Og Mandino

333.quote: All you need is the plan, the road map, and the courage to press on to your destination.
333.author: Earl Nightingale

334.quote: In a gentle way, you can shake the world.
334.author: Mahatma Gandhi

335.quote: There is a loftier ambition than merely to stand high in the world. It is to stoop down and lift mankind a little higher.
335.author: Henry Van Dyke

336.quote: Turn your face to the sun and the shadows fall behind you.
336.author: Unknown

337.quote: I believe in living today. Not in yesterday, nor in tomorrow.
337.author: Loretta Young

338.quote: It is in your moments of decision that your destiny is shaped.
338.author: Tony Robbins

339.quote: I thank you God for this most amazing day, for the leaping greenly spirits of trees, and for the blue dream of sky and for everything which is natural, which is infinite, which is yes.
339.author: e. e. cummings

341.quote: Do your little bit of good where you are; its those little bits of good put together that overwhelm the world.
341.author: Desmond Tutu

342.quote: You change your life by changing your heart.
342.author: Max Lucado

343.quote: We have it in our power to begin the world over again.
343.author: Thomas Paine

344.quote: The handicap of deafness is not in the ear; it is in the mind.
344.author: Marlee Matlin

345.quote: Most of us have far more courage than we ever dreamed we possessed.
345.author: Dale Carnegie

346.quote: The meaning I picked, the one that changed my life: Overcome fear, behold wonder.
346.author: Richard Bach

347.quote: Love is a fruit in season at all times, and within reach of every hand.
347.author: Mother Teresa

348.quote: The most beautiful thing in the world is, of course, the world itself.
348.author: Wallace Stevens

349.quote: Tears are often the telescope by which men see far into heaven.
349.author: Henry Ward Beecher

350.quote: Once I knew only darkness and stillness... my life was without past or future... but a little word from the fingers of another fell into my hand that clutched at emptiness, and my heart leaped to the rapture of living.
350.author: Helen Keller

351.quote: And when I breathed, my breath was lightning.
351.author: Black Elk

352.quote: Happiness is the natural flower of duty.
352.author: Phillips Brooks

353.quote: Our time here is magic! It's the only space you have to realize whatever it is that is beautiful, whatever is true, whatever is great, whatever is potential, whatever is rare, whatever is unique, in. It's the only space.
353.author: Ben Okri

354.quote: I love those who yearn for the impossible.
354.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

355.quote: One today is worth two tomorrows.
355.author: Benjamin Franklin

356.quote: Reach for it. Push yourself as far as you can.
356.author: Christa McAuliffe

357.quote: Joy descends gently upon us like the evening dew, and does not patter down like a hailstorm.
357.author: Jean Paul

359.quote: A #2 pencil and a dream can take you anywhere.
359.author: Joyce Meyer

360.quote: I believe there's an inner power that makes winners or losers. And the winners are the ones who really listen to the truth of their hearts.
360.author: Sylvester Stallone

361.quote: It seems to me we can never give up longing and wishing while we are thoroughly alive. There are certain things we feel to be beautiful and good, and we must hunger after them.
361.author: George Eliot

362.quote: As people are walking all the time, in the same spot, a path appears.
362.author: John Locke

363.quote: We can change our lives. We can do, have, and be exactly what we wish.
363.author: Tony Robbins

364.quote: Let every dawn be to you as the beginning of life, and every setting sun be to you as its close.
364.author: John Ruskin

365.quote: Every heart that has beat strongly and cheerfully has left a hopeful impulse behind it in the world, and bettered the tradition of mankind.
365.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

366.quote: Your ordinary acts of love and hope point to the extraordinary promise that every human life is of inestimable value.
366.author: Desmond Tutu

367.quote: Ah, but a man's reach should exceed his grasp, Or what's a heaven for?
367.author: Robert Browning

368.quote: A human being has so many skins inside, covering the depths of the heart. We know so many things, but we don't know ourselves! Why, thirty or forty skins or hides, as thick and hard as an ox's or bear's, cover the soul. Go into your own ground and learn to know yourself there.
368.author: Meister Eckhart

369.quote: Without craftsmanship, inspiration is a mere reed shaken in the wind.
369.author: Johannes Brahms

370.quote: Let each man exercise the art he knows.
370.author: Aristophanes

371.quote: Act like you expect to get into the end zone.
371.author: Christopher Morley

373.quote: To the mind that is still, the whole universe surrenders.
373.author: Lao Tzu

374.quote: Hope is but the dream of those who wake.
374.author: Matthew Prior

375.quote: What we achieve inwardly will change outer reality.
375.author: Plutarch

376.quote: I believe that one defines oneself by reinvention. To not be like your parents. To not be like your friends. To be yourself. To cut yourself out of stone.
376.author: Henry Rollins

377.quote: If you could only love enough, you could be the most powerful person in the world.
377.author: Emmet Fox

378.quote: Yesterday we obeyed kings and bent our necks before emperors. But today we kneel only to truth, follow only beauty, and obey only love.
378.author: Khalil Gibran

379.quote: Vitality shows in not only the ability to persist but the ability to start over.
379.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

380.quote: From what we get, we can make a living; what we give, however, makes a life.
380.author: Arthur Ashe

381.quote: I am so fresh in soul and spirit that life gushes and bubbles around me in a thousand springs.
381.author: Robert Schumann

382.quote: You don't look out there for God, something in the sky, you look in you.
382.author: Alan Watts

383.quote: Ideas shape the course of history.
383.author: John Maynard Keynes

384.quote: Of all human activities, man's listening to God is the supreme act of his reasoning and will.
384.author: Pope Paul VI

385.quote: The truth is on the march and nothing will stop it.
385.author: Emile Zola

386.quote: I celebrate myself, and sing myself.
386.author: Walt Whitman

388.quote: Show me your hands. Do they have scars from giving? Show me your feet. Are they wounded in service? Show me your heart. Have you left a place for divine love?
388.author: Fulton J. Sheen

390.quote: Be faithful to that which exists within yourself.
390.author: Andre Gide

391.quote: From its brilliancy everything is illuminated.
391.author: Guru Nanak

392.quote: Nothing makes one feel so strong as a call for help.
392.author: Pope Paul VI

393.quote: The only thing that ultimately matters is to eat an ice-cream cone, play a slide trombone, plant a small tree, good God, now you're free.
393.author: Ray Manzarek

394.quote: Nothing is worth more than this day.
394.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

395.quote: Each day provides its own gifts.
395.author: Marcus Aurelius

396.quote: Find out who you are and be that person. That's what your soul was put on this Earth to be. Find that truth, live that truth and everything else will come.
396.author: Ellen DeGeneres

397.quote: Grace is the beauty of form under the influence of freedom.
397.author: Friedrich Schiller

398.quote: It is by acts and not by ideas that people live.
398.author: Anatole France

399.quote: I said to the almond tree, 'Friend, speak to me of God,' and the almond tree blossomed.
399.author: Nikos Kazantzakis

400.quote: I've been absolutely terrified every moment of my life - and I've never let it keep me from doing a single thing I wanted to do.
400.author: Georgia O'Keeffe

401.quote: I arise full of eagerness and energy, knowing well what achievement lies ahead of me.
401.author: Zane Grey

402.quote: And now, this is the sweetest and most glorious day that ever my eyes did see.
402.author: Donald Cargill

403.quote: For a gallant spirit there can never be defeat.
403.author: Wallis Simpson

404.quote: On the recollection of so many and great favours and blessings, I now, with a high sense of gratitude, presume to offer up my sincere thanks to the Almighty, the Creator and Preserver.
404.author: William Bartram

406.quote: There is nothing stronger in the world than gentleness.
406.author: Han Suyin

407.quote: Love and desire are the spirit's wings to great deeds.
407.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

408.quote: Cherish your visions and your dreams as they are the children of your soul, the blueprints of your ultimate achievements.
408.author: Napoleon Hill

409.quote: Today is the only day. Yesterday is gone.
409.author: John Wooden

410.quote: Noble deeds that are concealed are most esteemed.
410.author: Blaise Pascal

411.quote: If the doors of perception were cleansed everything would appear to man as it is, infinite.
411.author: William Blake

412.quote: Silence is the last thing the world will ever hear from me.
412.author: Marlee Matlin

413.quote: What makes the desert beautiful is that somewhere it hides a well.
413.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

414.quote: When we seek to discover the best in others, we somehow bring out the best in ourselves.
414.author: William Arthur Ward

415.quote: Learning how to be still, to really be still and let life happen - that stillness becomes a radiance.
415.author: Morgan Freeman

416.quote: Every moment and every event of every man's life on earth plants something in his soul.
416.author: Thomas Merton

417.quote: Once we believe in ourselves, we can risk curiosity, wonder, spontaneous delight, or any experience that reveals the human spirit.
417.author: e. e. cummings

418.quote: The only journey is the one within.
418.author: Rainer Maria Rilke

419.quote: The most authentic thing about us is our capacity to create, to overcome, to endure, to transform, to love and to be greater than our suffering.
419.author: Ben Okri

420.quote: I have always believed, and I still believe, that whatever good or bad fortune may come our way we can always give it meaning and transform it into something of value.
420.author: Hermann Hesse

421.quote: The Wright brothers flew right through the smoke screen of impossibility.
421.author: Charles Kettering

422.quote: Everything you want is out there waiting for you to ask. Everything you want also wants you. But you have to take action to get it.
422.author: Jules Renard

423.quote: I believe it is in my nature to dance by virtue of the beat of my heart, the pulse of my blood and the music in my mind.
423.author: Robert Fulghum

425.quote: I have looked into your eyes with my eyes. I have put my heart near your heart.
425.author: Pope John XXIII

426.quote: People tell you the world looks a certain way. Parents tell you how to think. Schools tell you how to think. TV. Religion. And then at a certain point, if you're lucky, you realize you can make up your own mind. Nobody sets the rules but you. You can design your own life.
426.author: Carrie-Anne Moss

427.quote: It is only in sorrow bad weather masters us; in joy we face the storm and defy it.
427.author: Amelia Barr

428.quote: Love the moment and the energy of that moment will spread beyond all boundaries.
428.author: Corita Kent

429.quote: Countless as the sands of the sea are human passions.
429.author: Nikolai Gogol

430.quote: I pray God may preserve your health and life many years.
430.author: Junipero Serra

431.quote: The books that help you most are those which make you think that most. The hardest way of learning is that of easy reading; but a great book that comes from a great thinker is a ship of thought, deep freighted with truth and beauty.
431.author: Pablo Neruda

432.quote: Courage, my friends; 'tis not too late to build a better world.
432.author: Tommy Douglas

433.quote: When deeds speak, words are nothing.
433.author: Pierre-Joseph Proudhon

434.quote: Your present circumstances don't determine where you can go; they merely determine where you start.
434.author: Nido Qubein

435.quote: Just what future the Designer of the universe has provided for the souls of men I do not know, I cannot prove. But I find that the whole order of Nature confirms my confidence that, if it is not like our noblest hopes and dreams, it will transcend them.
435.author: Henry Norris Russell

436.quote: God sleeps in the minerals, awakens in plants, walks in animals, and thinks in man.
436.author: Arthur Young

437.quote: Give light and people will find the way.
437.author: Ella Baker

438.quote: Health is the greatest possession. Contentment is the greatest treasure. Confidence is the greatest friend. Non-being is the greatest joy.
438.author: Lao Tzu

439.quote: Look within. Within is the fountain of good, and it will ever bubble up, if thou wilt ever dig.
439.author: Marcus Aurelius

440.quote: How glorious a greeting the sun gives the mountains!
440.author: John Muir

441.quote: It is not ignorance but knowledge which is the mother of wonder.
441.author: Joseph Wood Krutch

442.quote: Every charitable act is a stepping stone toward heaven.
442.author: Henry Ward Beecher

443.quote: Lord, grant that I may always desire more than I can accomplish.
443.author: Michelangelo

444.quote: The fact that I can plant a seed and it becomes a flower, share a bit of knowledge and it becomes another's, smile at someone and receive a smile in return, are to me continual spiritual exercises.
444.author: Leo Buscaglia

445.quote: Keep your feet on the ground, but let your heart soar as high as it will. Refuse to be average or to surrender to the chill of your spiritual environment.
445.author: Arthur Helps

446.quote: It's a moment that I'm after, a fleeting moment, but not a frozen moment.
446.author: Andrew Wyeth

447.quote: The essential elements of giving are power and love - activity and affection - and the consciousness of the race testifies that in the high and appropriate exercise of these is a blessedness greater than any other.
447.author: Mark Hopkins

448.quote: The glow of one warm thought is to me worth more than money.
448.author: Thomas Jefferson

449.quote: Thinking: the talking of the soul with itself.
449.author: Plato

450.quote: Every day we should hear at least one little song, read one good poem, see one exquisite picture, and, if possible, speak a few sensible words.
450.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

451.quote: Miracles are a retelling in small letters of the very same story which is written across the whole world in letters too large for some of us to see.
451.author: C. S. Lewis

452.quote: A compliment is something like a kiss through a veil.
452.author: Victor Hugo

453.quote: To love means loving the unlovable. To forgive means pardoning the unpardonable. Faith means believing the unbelievable. Hope means hoping when everything seems hopeless.
453.author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

454.quote: I believe that if one always looked at the skies, one would end up with wings.
454.author: Gustave Flaubert

455.quote: Mankind is made great or little by its own will.
455.author: Friedrich Schiller

456.quote: When you have a dream, you've got to grab it and never let go.
456.author: Carol Burnett

457.quote: Too low they build, who build beneath the stars.
457.author: Edward Young

458.quote: We relish news of our heroes, forgetting that we are extraordinary to somebody too.
458.author: Helen Hayes

459.quote: Whatever you vividly imagine, ardently desire, sincerely believe, and enthusiastically act upon... must inevitably come to pass!
459.author: Paul J. Meyer

460.quote: I am not afraid of tomorrow, for I have seen yesterday and I love today!
460.author: William Allen White

461.quote: Our ideals are our better selves.
461.author: Amos Bronson Alcott

462.quote: And above all things, never think that you're not good enough yourself. A man should never think that. My belief is that in life people will take you at your own reckoning.
462.author: Isaac Asimov

463.quote: The authentic self is the soul made visible.
463.author: Sarah Ban Breathnach

464.quote: I want to make this world perfect.
464.author: Malala Yousafzai

465.quote: Men must live and create. Live to the point of tears.
465.author: Albert Camus

466.quote: We are here to make another world.
466.author: W. Edwards Deming

467.quote: Hope is some extraordinary spiritual grace that God gives us to control our fears, not to oust them.
467.author: Vincent McNabb

468.quote: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.
468.author: Confucius

469.quote: Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself.
469.author: George Bernard Shaw

470.quote: Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment.
470.author: Buddha

471.quote: Very little is needed to make a happy life; it is all within yourself, in your way of thinking.
471.author: Marcus Aurelius

472.quote: We do not remember days, we remember moments.
472.author: Cesare Pavese

473.quote: The most important thing is to enjoy your life - to be happy - it's all that matters.
473.author: Audrey Hepburn

474.quote: In the end, it's not the years in your life that count. It's the life in your years.
474.author: Abraham Lincoln

475.quote: Life is not a problem to be solved, but a reality to be experienced.
475.author: Soren Kierkegaard

476.quote: Sometimes life hits you in the head with a brick. Don't lose faith.
476.author: Steve Jobs

477.quote: Life is a dream for the wise, a game for the fool, a comedy for the rich, a tragedy for the poor.
477.author: Sholom Aleichem

478.quote: If you live long enough, you'll make mistakes. But if you learn from them, you'll be a better person. It's how you handle adversity, not how it affects you. The main thing is never quit, never quit, never quit.
478.author: William J. Clinton

479.quote: The purpose of our lives is to be happy.
479.author: Dalai Lama

480.quote: The truth is you don't know what is going to happen tomorrow. Life is a crazy ride, and nothing is guaranteed.
480.author: Eminem

481.quote: Life's most persistent and urgent question is, 'What are you doing for others?'
481.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

482.quote: Life is a song - sing it. Life is a game - play it. Life is a challenge - meet it. Life is a dream - realize it. Life is a sacrifice - offer it. Life is love - enjoy it.
482.author: Sai Baba

483.quote: The good life is one inspired by love and guided by knowledge.
483.author: Bertrand Russell

484.quote: Life is 10 percent what you make it, and 90 percent how you take it.
484.author: Irving Berlin

485.quote: Throughout life people will make you mad, disrespect you and treat you bad. Let God deal with the things they do, cause hate in your heart will consume you too.
485.author: Will Smith

486.quote: I have found that if you love life, life will love you back.
486.author: Arthur Rubinstein

487.quote: The privilege of a lifetime is being who you are.
487.author: Joseph Campbell

488.quote: The true secret of happiness lies in taking a genuine interest in all the details of daily life.
488.author: William Morris

489.quote: You have enemies? Good. That means you've stood up for something, sometime in your life.
489.author: Winston Churchill

490.quote: Life is a series of natural and spontaneous changes. Don't resist them - that only creates sorrow. Let reality be reality. Let things flow naturally forward in whatever way they like.
490.author: Lao Tzu

491.quote: One way to get the most out of life is to look upon it as an adventure.
491.author: William Feather

492.quote: Life is a tragedy when seen in close-up, but a comedy in long-shot.
492.author: Charlie Chaplin

493.quote: Our prime purpose in this life is to help others. And if you can't help them, at least don't hurt them.
493.author: Dalai Lama

495.quote: Beware the barrenness of a busy life.
495.author: Socrates

496.quote: This life, which had been the tomb of his virtue and of his honour, is but a walking shadow; a poor player, that struts and frets his hour upon the stage, and then is heard no more: it is a tale told by an idiot, full of sound and fury, signifying nothing.
496.author: William Shakespeare

497.quote: It takes half your life before you discover life is a do-it-yourself project.
497.author: Napoleon Hill

498.quote: A baby is God's opinion that life should go on.
498.author: Carl Sandburg

499.quote: Our life always expresses the result of our dominant thoughts.
499.author: Soren Kierkegaard

500.quote: Open your eyes, look within. Are you satisfied with the life you're living?
500.author: Bob Marley

501.quote: Our life is what our thoughts make it.
501.author: Marcus Aurelius

502.quote: You will never be happy if you continue to search for what happiness consists of. You will never live if you are looking for the meaning of life.
502.author: Albert Camus

503.quote: Life is short and we have never too much time for gladdening the hearts of those who are travelling the dark journey with us. Oh be swift to love, make haste to be kind.
503.author: Henri Frederic Amiel

504.quote: Life itself is the most wonderful fairy tale.
504.author: Hans Christian Andersen

505.quote: How far you go in life depends on your being tender with the young, compassionate with the aged, sympathetic with the striving and tolerant of the weak and strong. Because someday in your life you will have been all of these.
505.author: George Washington Carver

506.quote: He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.
506.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

507.quote: Life is a mirror and will reflect back to the thinker what he thinks into it.
507.author: Ernest Holmes

508.quote: We need to give each other the space to grow, to be ourselves, to exercise our diversity. We need to give each other space so that we may both give and receive such beautiful things as ideas, openness, dignity, joy, healing, and inclusion.
508.author: Max de Pree

509.quote: The true object of all human life is play. Earth is a task garden; heaven is a playground.
509.author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

510.quote: There are three constants in life... change, choice and principles.
510.author: Stephen Covey

511.quote: A man who dares to waste one hour of time has not discovered the value of life.
511.author: Charles Darwin

512.quote: A life is not important except in the impact it has on other lives.
512.author: Jackie Robinson

513.quote: Into each life some rain must fall.
513.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

514.quote: I have a simple philosophy: Fill what's empty. Empty what's full. Scratch where it itches.
514.author: Alice Roosevelt Longworth

515.quote: The story of life is quicker than the blink of an eye, the story of love is hello, goodbye.
515.author: Jimi Hendrix

516.quote: You're only here for a short visit. Don't hurry, don't worry. And be sure to smell the flowers along the way.
516.author: Walter Hagen

517.quote: A life spent making mistakes is not only more honorable, but more useful than a life spent doing nothing.
517.author: George Bernard Shaw

518.quote: I went to the woods because I wished to live deliberately, to front only the essential facts of life, and see if I could not learn what it had to teach, and not, when I came to die, discover that I had not lived.
518.author: Henry David Thoreau

519.quote: Only a life lived for others is a life worthwhile.
519.author: Albert Einstein

520.quote: There is more to life than increasing its speed.
520.author: Mahatma Gandhi

521.quote: Life would be tragic if it weren't funny.
521.author: Stephen Hawking

522.quote: What do we live for, if not to make life less difficult for each other?
522.author: George Eliot

523.quote: The monotony and solitude of a quiet life stimulates the creative mind.
523.author: Albert Einstein

524.quote: Life isn't a matter of milestones, but of moments.
524.author: Rose Kennedy

525.quote: When I stand before God at the end of my life, I would hope that I would not have a single bit of talent left, and could say, 'I used everything you gave me'.
525.author: Erma Bombeck

526.quote: I don't believe people are looking for the meaning of life as much as they are looking for the experience of being alive.
526.author: Joseph Campbell

527.quote: Nobody made a greater mistake than he who did nothing because he could do only a little.
527.author: Edmund Burke

528.quote: If you love life, don't waste time, for time is what life is made up of.
528.author: Bruce Lee

529.quote: Life is what happens while you are busy making other plans.
529.author: John Lennon

530.quote: The less routine the more life.
530.author: Amos Bronson Alcott

531.quote: Life is ten percent what happens to you and ninety percent how you respond to it.
531.author: Lou Holtz

532.quote: Never be bullied into silence. Never allow yourself to be made a victim. Accept no one's definition of your life; define yourself.
532.author: Harvey Fierstein

533.quote: I take care of my flowers and my cats. And enjoy food. And that's living.
533.author: Ursula Andress

534.quote: Life is too short for long-term grudges.
534.author: Elon Musk

535.quote: Nothing in life is to be feared, it is only to be understood. Now is the time to understand more, so that we may fear less.
535.author: Marie Curie

536.quote: No man is a failure who is enjoying life.
536.author: William Feather

537.quote: The only disability in life is a bad attitude.
537.author: Scott Hamilton

538.quote: Don't go around saying the world owes you a living. The world owes you nothing. It was here first.
538.author: Mark Twain

539.quote: I slept and dreamt that life was joy. I awoke and saw that life was service. I acted and behold, service was joy.
539.author: Rabindranath Tagore

540.quote: All life is an experiment. The more experiments you make the better.
540.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

541.quote: The hardest years in life are those between ten and seventy.
541.author: Helen Hayes

542.quote: What if you gave someone a gift, and they neglected to thank you for it - would you be likely to give them another? Life is the same way. In order to attract more of the blessings that life has to offer, you must truly appreciate what you already have.
542.author: Ralph Marston

543.quote: Good friends, good books and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life.
543.author: Mark Twain

544.quote: A person will sometimes devote all his life to the development of one part of his body - the wishbone.
544.author: Robert Frost

545.quote: Life is a succession of moments, to live each one is to succeed.
545.author: Corita Kent

546.quote: Every man dies. Not every man really lives.
546.author: William Wallace

547.quote: If life had a second edition, how I would correct the proofs.
547.author: John Clare

548.quote: What we think determines what happens to us, so if we want to change our lives, we need to stretch our minds.
548.author: Wayne Dyer

549.quote: Most people have never learned that one of the main aims in life is to enjoy it.
549.author: Samuel Butler

550.quote: The greatest pleasure of life is love.
550.author: Euripides

551.quote: The shoe that fits one person pinches another; there is no recipe for living that suits all cases.
551.author: Carl Jung

552.quote: The personal life deeply lived always expands into truths beyond itself.
552.author: Anais Nin

553.quote: The greatest trap in our life is not success, popularity or power, but self-rejection.
553.author: Henri Nouwen

555.quote: To live is like to love - all reason is against it, and all healthy instinct for it.
555.author: Samuel Butler

556.quote: We live in a rainbow of chaos.
556.author: Paul Cezanne

557.quote: Maybe all one can do is hope to end up with the right regrets.
557.author: Arthur Miller

558.quote: When we remember we are all mad, the mysteries disappear and life stands explained.
558.author: Mark Twain

559.quote: Life is a long lesson in humility.
559.author: James M. Barrie

560.quote: A man sooner or later discovers that he is the master-gardener of his soul, the director of his life.
560.author: James Allen

561.quote: Each one of us decides to incarnate upon this planet at a particular point in time and space. We have chosen to come here to learn a particular lesson that will advance us upon our spiritual, evolutionary pathway.
561.author: Louise L. Hay

562.quote: Life is a tide; float on it. Go down with it and go up with it, but be detached. Then it is not difficult.
562.author: Prem Rawat

563.quote: Once you say you're going to settle for second, that's what happens to you in life.
563.author: John F. Kennedy

564.quote: Life is a moderately good play with a badly written third act.
564.author: Truman Capote

565.quote: Life is what we make it, always has been, always will be.
565.author: Grandma Moses

566.quote: To live a pure unselfish life, one must count nothing as one's own in the midst of abundance.
566.author: Buddha

567.quote: Every man regards his own life as the New Year's Eve of time.
567.author: Jean Paul

568.quote: The whole secret of life is to be interested in one thing profoundly and in a thousand things well.
568.author: Horace Walpole

569.quote: My formula for living is quite simple. I get up in the morning and I go to bed at night. In between, I occupy myself as best I can.
569.author: Cary Grant

570.quote: If life were predictable it would cease to be life, and be without flavor.
570.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

571.quote: Nothing is more precious than life... especially the life of your child.
571.author: Peter Diamandis

572.quote: A chain is no stronger than its weakest link, and life is after all a chain.
572.author: William James

573.quote: Once you bring life into the world, you must protect it. We must protect it by changing the world.
573.author: Elie Wiesel

574.quote: Life is pleasant. Death is peaceful. It's the transition that's troublesome.
574.author: Isaac Asimov

575.quote: Any idiot can face a crisis - it's day to day living that wears you out.
575.author: Anton Chekhov

576.quote: Life is a culmination of the past, an awareness of the present, an indication of a future beyond knowledge, the quality that gives a touch of divinity to matter.
576.author: Charles Lindbergh

577.quote: Life is a great sunrise. I do not see why death should not be an even greater one.
577.author: Vladimir Nabokov

578.quote: I am I plus my circumstances.
578.author: Jose Ortega y Gasset

579.quote: What a wonderful life I've had! I only wish I'd realized it sooner.
579.author: Sidonie Gabrielle Colette

580.quote: Doing what you love is the cornerstone of having abundance in your life.
580.author: Wayne Dyer

581.quote: Life becomes harder for us when we live for others, but it also becomes richer and happier.
581.author: Albert Schweitzer

582.quote: Life itself is the proper binge.
582.author: Julia Child

583.quote: Life is made up of marble and mud.
583.author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

584.quote: Mindfulness is about love and loving life. When you cultivate this love, it gives you clarity and compassion for life, and your actions happen in accordance with that.
584.author: Jon Kabat-Zinn

585.quote: Life's a fight. It's a good fight of faith.
585.author: Joel Osteen

586.quote: Life is wasted on the living.
586.author: Douglas Adams

587.quote: Any life is made up of a single moment, the moment in which a man finds out, once and for all, who he is.
587.author: Jorge Luis Borges

588.quote: It's all about quality of life and finding a happy balance between work and friends and family.
588.author: Philip Green

589.quote: We must be willing to let go of the life we have planned, so as to have the life that is waiting for us.
589.author: E. M. Forster

590.quote: There is only one difference between a long life and a good dinner: that, in the dinner, the sweets come last.
590.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

591.quote: Life will always be to a large extent what we ourselves make it.
591.author: Samuel Smiles

592.quote: To live is to change, and to be perfect is to have changed often.
592.author: John Henry Newman

593.quote: The quality, not the longevity, of one's life is what is important.
593.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

594.quote: Character develops itself in the stream of life.
594.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

595.quote: Life is something to do when you can't get to sleep.
595.author: Fran Lebowitz

596.quote: Only an artist can interpret the meaning of life.
596.author: Novalis

597.quote: It's only when we truly know and understand that we have a limited time on earth - and that we have no way of knowing when our time is up, we will then begin to live each day to the fullest, as if it was the only one we had.
597.author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

598.quote: The aim of life is to live, and to live means to be aware, joyously, drunkenly, serenely, divinely aware.
598.author: Henry Miller

599.quote: Not life, but good life, is to be chiefly valued.
599.author: Socrates

600.quote: While we are postponing, life speeds by.
600.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

601.quote: Variety's the very spice of life, That gives it all its flavor.
601.author: William Cowper

602.quote: We live in the world when we love it.
602.author: Rabindranath Tagore

603.quote: Life appears to me too short to be spent in nursing animosity, or registering wrongs.
603.author: Charlotte Bronte

604.quote: Fortunately analysis is not the only way to resolve inner conflicts. Life itself still remains a very effective therapist.
604.author: Karen Horney

605.quote: Unrest of spirit is a mark of life.
605.author: Karl A. Menninger

606.quote: To affect the quality of the day, that is the highest of arts.
606.author: Henry David Thoreau

607.quote: The courage of life is often a less dramatic spectacle than the courage of a final moment; but it is no less a magnificent mixture of triumph and tragedy.
607.author: John F. Kennedy

608.quote: It is often said that before you die your life passes before your eyes. It is in fact true. It's called living.
608.author: Terry Pratchett

609.quote: The indispensable first step to getting the things you want out of life is this: decide what you want.
609.author: Ben Stein

610.quote: What is important in life is life, and not the result of life.
610.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

611.quote: Life's like a play: it's not the length, but the excellence of the acting that matters.
611.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

612.quote: Why should we think upon things that are lovely? Because thinking determines life. It is a common habit to blame life upon the environment. Environment modifies life but does not govern life. The soul is stronger than its surroundings.
612.author: William James

613.quote: Give me the luxuries of life and I will willingly do without the necessities.
613.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

614.quote: I did not direct my life. I didn't design it. I never made decisions. Things always came up and made them for me. That's what life is.
614.author: B. F. Skinner

615.quote: All the art of living lies in a fine mingling of letting go and holding on.
615.author: Havelock Ellis

616.quote: I want to live my life, not record it.
616.author: Jackie Kennedy

617.quote: When I hear somebody sigh, 'Life is hard,' I am always tempted to ask, 'Compared to what?'
617.author: Sydney J. Harris

618.quote: Life is growth. If we stop growing, technically and spiritually, we are as good as dead.
618.author: Morihei Ueshiba

619.quote: Take care of your life and the Lord will take care of your death.
619.author: George Whitefield

620.quote: Life comes from the earth and life returns to the earth.
620.author: Zhuangzi

623.quote: There is a very fine line between loving life and being greedy for it.
623.author: Maya Angelou

624.quote: It is not length of life, but depth of life.
624.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

625.quote: Life imitates art far more than art imitates Life.
625.author: Oscar Wilde

626.quote: The price of anything is the amount of life you exchange for it.
626.author: Henry David Thoreau

627.quote: Art is the proper task of life.
627.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

628.quote: The art of living is more like wrestling than dancing.
628.author: Marcus Aurelius

629.quote: He not busy being born is busy dying.
629.author: Bob Dylan

630.quote: All of life is peaks and valleys. Don't let the peaks get too high and the valleys too low.
630.author: John Wooden

631.quote: As a well-spent day brings happy sleep, so a life well spent brings happy death.
631.author: Leonardo da Vinci

632.quote: I still find each day too short for all the thoughts I want to think, all the walks I want to take, all the books I want to read, and all the friends I want to see.
632.author: John Burroughs

633.quote: The greatest use of a life is to spend it on something that will outlast it.
633.author: William James

634.quote: There is no wealth but life.
634.author: John Ruskin

635.quote: The most satisfying thing in life is to have been able to give a large part of one's self to others.
635.author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin
