1189.quote: Friends can help each other. A true friend is someone who lets you have total freedom to be yourself - and especially to feel. Or, not feel. Whatever you happen to be feeling at the moment is fine with them. That's what real love amounts to - letting a person be what he really is.
1189.author: Jim Morrison

1190.quote: Love is composed of a single soul inhabiting two bodies.
1190.author: Aristotle

1191.quote: We are all born for love. It is the principle of existence, and its only end.
1191.author: Benjamin Disraeli

1192.quote: Where there is love there is life.
1192.author: Mahatma Gandhi

1193.quote: The sweetest of all sounds is that of the voice of the woman we love.
1193.author: Jean de la Bruyere

1194.quote: I have decided to stick with love. Hate is too great a burden to bear.
1194.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

1195.quote: To love and be loved is to feel the sun from both sides.
1195.author: David Viscott

1196.quote: We love life, not because we are used to living but because we are used to loving.
1196.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

1197.quote: There is no disguise which can hide love for long where it exists, or simulate it where it does not.
1197.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

1198.quote: I believe that imagination is stronger than knowledge. That myth is more potent than history. That dreams are more powerful than facts. That hope always triumphs over experience. That laughter is the only cure for grief. And I believe that love is stronger than death.
1198.author: Robert Fulghum

1199.quote: The most powerful weapon on earth is the human soul on fire.
1199.author: Ferdinand Foch

1201.quote: We are born of love; Love is our mother.
1201.author: Rumi

1202.quote: We waste time looking for the perfect lover, instead of creating the perfect love.
1202.author: Tom Robbins

1203.quote: Life is the flower for which love is the honey.
1203.author: Victor Hugo

1204.quote: Love is like a friendship caught on fire. In the beginning a flame, very pretty, often hot and fierce, but still only light and flickering. As love grows older, our hearts mature and our love becomes as coals, deep-burning and unquenchable.
1204.author: Bruce Lee

1205.quote: A woman knows the face of the man she loves as a sailor knows the open sea.
1205.author: Honore de Balzac

1206.quote: There can be no deep disappointment where there is not deep love.
1206.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

1207.quote: To say 'I love you' one must first be able to say the 'I.'
1207.author: Ayn Rand

1208.quote: Blessed is the influence of one true, loving human soul on another.
1208.author: George Eliot

1209.quote: Love has reasons which reason cannot understand.
1209.author: Blaise Pascal

1210.quote: Love is when he gives you a piece of your soul, that you never knew was missing.
1210.author: Torquato Tasso

1211.quote: I love that feeling of being in love, the effect of having butterflies when you wake up in the morning. That is special.
1211.author: Jennifer Aniston

1212.quote: A kiss is a lovely trick designed by nature to stop speech when words become superfluous.
1212.author: Ingrid Bergman

1213.quote: Life without love is like a tree without blossoms or fruit.
1213.author: Khalil Gibran

1214.quote: The course of true love never did run smooth.
1214.author: William Shakespeare

1215.quote: The hunger for love is much more difficult to remove than the hunger for bread.
1215.author: Mother Teresa

1216.quote: Affection is responsible for nine-tenths of whatever solid and durable happiness there is in our lives.
1216.author: C. S. Lewis

1217.quote: We're born alone, we live alone, we die alone. Only through our love and friendship can we create the illusion for the moment that we're not alone.
1217.author: Orson Welles

1218.quote: Love doesn't make the world go 'round. Love is what makes the ride worthwhile.
1218.author: Franklin P. Jones

1219.quote: We loved with a love that was more than love.
1219.author: Edgar Allan Poe

1220.quote: A part of kindness consists in loving people more than they deserve.
1220.author: Joseph Joubert

1221.quote: Love and compassion are necessities, not luxuries. Without them humanity cannot survive.
1221.author: Dalai Lama

1222.quote: Love yourself first and everything else falls into line. You really have to love yourself to get anything done in this world.
1222.author: Lucille Ball

1223.quote: Love is the flower you've got to let grow.
1223.author: John Lennon

1224.quote: Love is an irresistible desire to be irresistibly desired.
1224.author: Robert Frost

1225.quote: If your heart is a volcano, how shall you expect flowers to bloom?
1225.author: Khalil Gibran

1226.quote: I was born with an enormous need for affection, and a terrible need to give it.
1226.author: Audrey Hepburn

1227.quote: Love is the joy of the good, the wonder of the wise, the amazement of the Gods.
1227.author: Plato

1228.quote: Suffering passes, while love is eternal. That's a gift that you have received from God. Don't waste it.
1228.author: Laura Ingalls Wilder

1229.quote: In the flush of love's light, we dare be brave. And suddenly we see that love costs all we are, and will ever be. Yet it is only love which sets us free.
1229.author: Maya Angelou

1230.quote: Love is the crowning grace of humanity, the holiest right of the soul, the golden link which binds us to duty and truth, the redeeming principle that chiefly reconciles the heart to life, and is prophetic of eternal good.
1230.author: Petrarch

1231.quote: True love cannot be found where it does not exist, nor can it be denied where it does.
1231.author: Torquato Tasso

1232.quote: 'Tis better to have loved and lost than never to have loved at all.
1232.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

1233.quote: To love oneself is the beginning of a lifelong romance.
1233.author: Oscar Wilde

1234.quote: In our life there is a single color, as on an artist's palette, which provides the meaning of life and art. It is the color of love.
1234.author: Marc Chagall

1235.quote: I long for the raised voice, the howl of rage or love.
1235.author: Leslie Fiedler

1236.quote: There is only one real deprivation... and that is not to be able to give one's gifts to those one loves most.
1236.author: May Sarton

1237.quote: There is only one kind of love, but there are a thousand imitations.
1237.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

1238.quote: Love is like a beautiful flower which I may not touch, but whose fragrance makes the garden a place of delight just the same.
1238.author: Helen Keller

1239.quote: The only abnormality is the incapacity to love.
1239.author: Anais Nin

1240.quote: The art of love is largely the art of persistence.
1240.author: Albert Ellis

1241.quote: True love comes quietly, without banners or flashing lights. If you hear bells, get your ears checked.
1241.author: Erich Segal

1243.quote: Though lovers be lost love shall not.
1243.author: Dylan Thomas

1244.quote: A loving heart is the truest wisdom.
1244.author: Charles Dickens

1245.quote: Accustom yourself continually to make many acts of love, for they enkindle and melt the soul.
1245.author: Saint Teresa of Avila

1246.quote: Lord, grant that I might not so much seek to be loved as to love.
1246.author: Francis of Assisi

1247.quote: Love is life. And if you miss love, you miss life.
1247.author: Leo Buscaglia

1248.quote: Man must evolve for all human conflict a method which rejects revenge, aggression and retaliation. The foundation of such a method is love.
1248.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

1250.quote: We are never so defensless against suffering as when we love.
1250.author: Sigmund Freud

1251.quote: Absence - that common cure of love.
1251.author: Lord Byron

1252.quote: True love is eternal, infinite, and always like itself. It is equal and pure, without violent demonstrations: it is seen with white hairs and is always young in the heart.
1252.author: Honore de Balzac

1253.quote: Love knows not distance; it hath no continent; its eyes are for the stars.
1253.author: Gilbert Parker

1254.quote: You, yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection.
1254.author: Buddha

1255.quote: We love but once, for once only are we perfectly equipped for loving.
1255.author: Cyril Connolly

1256.quote: To be able to say how much love, is love but little.
1256.author: Petrarch

1257.quote: If you wished to be loved, love.
1257.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

1258.quote: Faith makes all things possible... love makes all things easy.
1258.author: Dwight L. Moody

1259.quote: For small creatures such as we the vastness is bearable only through love.
1259.author: Carl Sagan

1260.quote: There is more pleasure in loving than in being beloved.
1260.author: Thomas Fuller

1261.quote: Love is the only reality and it is not a mere sentiment. It is the ultimate truth that lies at the heart of creation.
1261.author: Rabindranath Tagore

1262.quote: If you can learn to love yourself and all the flaws, you can love other people so much better. And that makes you so happy.
1262.author: Kristin Chenoweth

1263.quote: Love is a sacred reserve of energy; it is like the blood of spiritual evolution.
1263.author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin

1264.quote: Love is, above all, the gift of oneself.
1264.author: Jean Anouilh

1265.quote: The first duty of love is to listen.
1265.author: Paul Tillich

1266.quote: No, there's nothing half so sweet in life as love's young dream.
1266.author: Thomas Moore

1267.quote: In love the paradox occurs that two beings become one and yet remain two.
1267.author: Erich Fromm

1268.quote: Only do what your heart tells you.
1268.author: Princess Diana

1269.quote: The more one judges, the less one loves.
1269.author: Honore de Balzac

1270.quote: Love's greatest gift is its ability to make everything it touches sacred.
1270.author: Barbara De Angelis

1271.quote: Don't walk in front of me, I may not follow. Don't walk behind me, I may not lead. There is only one happiness in life, to love and be loved.
1271.author: George Sand

1272.quote: There is room in the smallest cottage for a happy loving pair.
1272.author: Friedrich Schiller

1273.quote: A very small degree of hope is sufficient to cause the birth of love.
1273.author: Stendhal

1276.quote: There isn't any formula or method. You learn to love by loving - by paying attention and doing what one thereby discovers has to be done.
1276.author: Aldous Huxley

1278.quote: Be of love a little more careful than of anything.
1278.author: e. e. cummings

1279.quote: I think it is all a matter of love: the more you love a memory, the stronger and stranger it is.
1279.author: Vladimir Nabokov

1280.quote: If thou must love me, let it be for naught except for love's sake only.
1280.author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

1281.quote: It is sad not to love, but it is much sadder not to be able to love.
1281.author: Miguel de Unamuno

1282.quote: Love is the magician that pulls man out of his own hat.
1282.author: Ben Hecht

1283.quote: All my life, my heart has yearned for a thing I cannot name.
1283.author: Andre Breton

1284.quote: Those who have never known the deep intimacy and the intense companionship of mutual love have missed the best thing that life has to give.
1284.author: Bertrand Russell

1285.quote: I like not only to be loved, but also to be told I am loved.
1285.author: George Eliot

1286.quote: The love we give away is the only love we keep.
1286.author: Elbert Hubbard

1287.quote: Love is a friendship set to music.
1287.author: Joseph Campbell

1288.quote: Self-love is the source of all our other loves.
1288.author: Pierre Corneille

1289.quote: Love is the only sane and satisfactory answer to the problem of human existence.
1289.author: Erich Fromm

1290.quote: Love makes your soul crawl out from its hiding place.
1290.author: Zora Neale Hurston

1291.quote: Love consists in this, that two solitudes protect and touch and greet each other.
1291.author: Rainer Maria Rilke

1292.quote: If you do not love me I shall not be loved If I do not love you I shall not love.
1292.author: Samuel Beckett

1293.quote: Love is the greatest gift that God has given us. It's free.
1293.author: Taraji P. Henson

1294.quote: Love cures people - both the ones who give it and the ones who receive it.
1294.author: Karl A. Menninger

1295.quote: There is no limit to the power of loving.
1295.author: John Morton

1296.quote: The journey from teaching about love to allowing myself to be loved proved much longer than I realised.
1296.author: Henri Nouwen

1297.quote: One must not trifle with love.
1297.author: Alfred de Musset

1298.quote: When we are in love we seem to ourselves quite different from what we were before.
1298.author: Blaise Pascal

1299.quote: Sometimes it's a form of love just to talk to somebody that you have nothing in common with and still be fascinated by their presence.
1299.author: David Byrne

1300.quote: In every living thing there is the desire for love.
1300.author: D. H. Lawrence

1302.quote: You don't have to go looking for love when it's where you come from.
1302.author: Werner Erhard

1303.quote: Love is like an hourglass, with the heart filling up as the brain empties.
1303.author: Jules Renard

1305.quote: The one thing we can never get enough of is love. And the one thing we never give enough is love.
1305.author: Henry Miller

1306.quote: Who so loves believes the impossible.
1306.author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

1307.quote: Love is an energy which exists of itself. It is its own value.
1307.author: Thornton Wilder

1308.quote: Love is a mutual self-giving which ends in self-recovery.
1308.author: Fulton J. Sheen

1309.quote: We cease loving ourselves if no one loves us.
1309.author: Madame de Stael

1310.quote: The crime of loving is forgetting.
1310.author: Maurice Chevalier

1311.quote: Love does not consist in gazing at each other, but in looking outward together in the same direction.
1311.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

1312.quote: It is love, not reason, that is stronger than death.
1312.author: Thomas Mann

1313.quote: Love takes off masks that we fear we cannot live without and know we cannot live within.
1313.author: James A. Baldwin

1314.quote: Each moment of a happy lover's hour is worth an age of dull and common life.
1314.author: Aphra Behn

1316.quote: Loved. You can't use it in the past tense. Death does not stop that love at all.
1316.author: Ken Kesey

1317.quote: Tell me who admires and loves you, and I will tell you who you are.
1317.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

1318.quote: Love is a better teacher than duty.
1318.author: Albert Einstein

1319.quote: The sweetest noise on earth, a woman's tongue; A string which hath no discord.
1319.author: Bryan Procter

1320.quote: Loving others always costs us something and requires effort. And you have to decide to do it on purpose. You can't wait for a feeling to motivate you.
1320.author: Joyce Meyer

1321.quote: The eyes those silent tongues of love.
1321.author: Miguel de Cervantes

1322.quote: To good and true love fear is forever affixed.
1322.author: Francois Rabelais

1323.quote: I can live without money, but I cannot live without love.
1323.author: Judy Garland

1324.quote: Let no one who loves be unhappy, even love unreturned has its rainbow.
1324.author: James M. Barrie

1325.quote: First love is only a little foolishness and a lot of curiosity.
1325.author: George Bernard Shaw

1326.quote: The degree of loving is measured by the degree of giving.
1326.author: Edwin Louis Cole

1327.quote: Love is like a faucet, it turns off and on.
1327.author: Billie Holiday

1328.quote: Your words are my food, your breath my wine. You are everything to me.
1328.author: Sarah Bernhardt

1329.quote: It is easier to love humanity as a whole than to love one's neighbor.
1329.author: Eric Hoffer

1330.quote: People happy in love have an air of intensity.
1330.author: Stendhal

1331.quote: Love... it surrounds every being and extends slowly to embrace all that shall be.
1331.author: Khalil Gibran

1333.quote: Love looks through a telescope; envy, through a microscope.
1333.author: Josh Billings

1334.quote: Once the realization is accepted that even between the closest human beings infinite distances continue, a wonderful living side by side can grow, if they succeed in loving the distance between them which makes it possible for each to see the other whole against the sky.
1334.author: Rainer Maria Rilke

1335.quote: I am happier when I love than when I am loved. I adore my husband, my son, my grandchildren, my mother, my dog, and frankly, I don't know if they even like me. But who cares? Loving them is my joy.
1335.author: Isabel Allende

1337.quote: No one has ever loved anyone the way everyone wants to be loved.
1337.author: Mignon McLaughlin

1338.quote: To love for the sake of being loved is human, but to love for the sake of loving is angelic.
1338.author: Alphonse de Lamartine

1339.quote: Love is an act of endless forgiveness, a tender look which becomes a habit.
1339.author: Peter Ustinov

1340.quote: Love is the child of illusion and the parent of disillusion.
1340.author: Miguel de Unamuno

1341.quote: Oh, love will make a dog howl in rhyme.
1341.author: Francis Beaumont

1342.quote: Love is the poetry of the senses.
1342.author: Honore de Balzac

1343.quote: Love seeketh not itself to please, nor for itself hath any care, but for another gives its ease, and builds a Heaven in Hell's despair.
1343.author: William Blake

1344.quote: It's important for us to latch onto the people that we love.
1344.author: Connie Stevens

1345.quote: How absurd and delicious it is to be in love with somebody younger than yourself. Everybody should try it.
1345.author: Barbara Pym

1346.quote: To witness two lovers is a spectacle for the gods.
1346.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

1347.quote: Love in its essence is spiritual fire.
1347.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

1348.quote: A loving heart is the beginning of all knowledge.
1348.author: Thomas Carlyle

1349.quote: He is not a lover who does not love forever.
1349.author: Euripides

1350.quote: All love is vanquished by a succeeding love.
1350.author: Ovid

1351.quote: Do you have to have a reason for loving?
1351.author: Brigitte Bardot

1352.quote: Love you will find only where you may show yourself weak without provoking strength.
1352.author: Theodor Adorno

1354.quote: Love is that splendid triggering of human vitality the supreme activity which nature affords anyone for going out of himself toward someone else.
1354.author: Jose Ortega y Gasset

1355.quote: Great thoughts come from the heart.
1355.author: Luc de Clapiers

1356.quote: The love of our private friends is the only preparatory exercise for the love of all men.
1356.author: John Henry Newman

1357.quote: The richest love is that which submits to the arbitration of time.
1357.author: Lawrence Durrell

1358.quote: Follow love and it will flee, flee love and it will follow thee.
1358.author: John Gay

1359.quote: Love has no errors, for all errors are the want for love.
1359.author: William Law

1360.quote: When we lose one we love, our bitterest tears are called forth by the memory of hours when we loved not enough.
1360.author: Maurice Maeterlinck

1361.quote: It is impossible to repent of love. The sin of love does not exist.
1361.author: Muriel Spark

1362.quote: Nobody has ever measured, not even poets, how much the heart can hold.
1362.author: Zelda Fitzgerald

1363.quote: Gravitation is not responsible for people falling in love.
1363.author: Albert Einstein

1364.quote: Passion is momentary; love is enduring.
1364.author: John Wooden

1365.quote: The first magic of love is our ignorance that it can ever end.
1365.author: Benjamin Disraeli

1366.quote: To fear love is to fear life, and those who fear life are already three parts dead.
1366.author: Bertrand Russell

1367.quote: Someday, after mastering the winds, the waves, the tides and gravity, we shall harness for God the energies of love, and then, for a second time in the history of the world, man will have discovered fire.
1367.author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin

1368.quote: Love takes up where knowledge leaves off.
1368.author: Thomas Aquinas

1369.quote: Nobody loves a woman because she is handsome or ugly, stupid or intelligent. We love because we love.
1369.author: Honore de Balzac

1370.quote: Love does not begin and end the way we seem to think it does. Love is a battle, love is a war; love is a growing up.
1370.author: James A. Baldwin

1372.quote: Love is the ultimate expression of the will to live.
1372.author: Tom Wolfe

1373.quote: Can miles truly separate you from friends... If you want to be with someone you love, aren't you already there?
1373.author: Richard Bach

1374.quote: Love is a springtime plant that perfumes everything with its hope, even the ruins to which it clings.
1374.author: Gustave Flaubert

1375.quote: But love's a malady without a cure.
1375.author: John Dryden

1376.quote: Pains of love be sweeter far than all other pleasures are.
1376.author: John Dryden

1377.quote: The highest function of love is that it makes the loved one a unique and irreplacable being.
1377.author: Tom Robbins

1378.quote: If it is your time, love will track you down like a cruise missile.
1378.author: Lynda Barry

1379.quote: Take away love and our earth is a tomb.
1379.author: Robert Browning

1380.quote: Selfishness is one of the qualities apt to inspire love.
1380.author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

1381.quote: The love we have in our youth is superficial compared to the love that an old man has for his old wife.
1381.author: Will Durant

1383.quote: More than kisses, letters mingle souls.
1383.author: John Donne

1384.quote: Love is supreme and unconditional; like is nice but limited.
1384.author: Duke Ellington

1385.quote: To love is to admire with the heart; to admire is to love with the mind.
1385.author: Theophile Gautier

1386.quote: When you love a man, he becomes more than a body. His physical limbs expand, and his outline recedes, vanishes. He is rich and sweet and right. He is part of the world, the atmosphere, the blue sky and the blue water.
1386.author: Gwendolyn Brooks

1387.quote: Only divine love bestows the keys of knowledge.
1387.author: Arthur Rimbaud

1388.quote: Only love interests me, and I am only in contact with things that revolve around love.
1388.author: Marc Chagall

1389.quote: When love is not madness, it is not love.
1389.author: Pedro Calderon de la Barca

1390.quote: One does not fall in love; one grows into love, and love grows in him.
1390.author: Karl A. Menninger

1391.quote: I believe in the compelling power of love. I do not understand it. I believe it to be the most fragrant blossom of all this thorny existence.
1391.author: Theodore Dreiser

1392.quote: As soon go kindle fire with snow, as seek to quench the fire of love with words.
1392.author: William Shakespeare

1393.quote: If you would be loved, love, and be loveable.
1393.author: Benjamin Franklin

1394.quote: A pair of powerful spectacles has sometimes sufficed to cure a person in love.
1394.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

1395.quote: Love is of all passions the strongest, for it attacks simultaneously the head, the heart and the senses.
1395.author: Lao Tzu

1396.quote: Love possesses not nor will it be possessed, for love is sufficient unto love.
1396.author: Khalil Gibran

1397.quote: Love is the triumph of imagination over intelligence.
1397.author: H. L. Mencken

1398.quote: The greatest happiness of life is the conviction that we are loved; loved for ourselves, or rather, loved in spite of ourselves.
1398.author: Victor Hugo

1399.quote: As the Father has loved me, so have I loved you.
1399.author: Jesus Christ

1400.quote: What we have once enjoyed we can never lose. All that we love deeply becomes a part of us.
1400.author: Helen Keller

1401.quote: Love is the beauty of the soul.
1401.author: Saint Augustine

1402.quote: The way to love anything is to realize that it may be lost.
1402.author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

1403.quote: One is loved because one is loved. No reason is needed for loving.
1403.author: Paulo Coelho

1404.quote: Success is nothing more than a few simple disciplines, practiced every day.
1404.author: Jim Rohn

1405.quote: Coming together is a beginning; keeping together is progress; working together is success.
1405.author: Henry Ford

1406.quote: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
1406.author: Winston Churchill

1407.quote: The starting point of all achievement is desire.
1407.author: Napoleon Hill

1408.quote: Try not to become a man of success, but rather try to become a man of value.
1408.author: Albert Einstein

1409.quote: The price of success is hard work, dedication to the job at hand, and the determination that whether we win or lose, we have applied the best of ourselves to the task at hand.
1409.author: Vince Lombardi

1410.quote: Always be yourself, express yourself, have faith in yourself, do not go out and look for a successful personality and duplicate it.
1410.author: Bruce Lee

1411.quote: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success. If you love what you are doing, you will be successful.
1411.author: Albert Schweitzer

1412.quote: Success is simple. Do what's right, the right way, at the right time.
1412.author: Arnold H. Glasow

1413.quote: If everyone is moving forward together, then success takes care of itself.
1413.author: Henry Ford

1414.quote: However difficult life may seem, there is always something you can do and succeed at.
1414.author: Stephen Hawking

1415.quote: Success consists of going from failure to failure without loss of enthusiasm.
1415.author: Winston Churchill

1416.quote: Action is the foundational key to all success.
1416.author: Pablo Picasso

1417.quote: Don't aim for success if you want it; just do what you love and believe in, and it will come naturally.
1417.author: David Frost

1418.quote: Success is a lousy teacher. It seduces smart people into thinking they can't lose.
1418.author: Bill Gates

1419.quote: Happiness lies in the joy of achievement and the thrill of creative effort.
1419.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

1420.quote: Take up one idea. Make that one idea your life - think of it, dream of it, live on that idea. Let the brain, muscles, nerves, every part of your body, be full of that idea, and just leave every other idea alone. This is the way to success.
1420.author: Swami Vivekananda

1421.quote: A successful man is one who can lay a firm foundation with the bricks others have thrown at him.
1421.author: David Brinkley

1422.quote: Desire is the key to motivation, but it's determination and commitment to an unrelenting pursuit of your goal - a commitment to excellence - that will enable you to attain the success you seek.
1422.author: Mario Andretti

1423.quote: Think twice before you speak, because your words and influence will plant the seed of either success or failure in the mind of another.
1423.author: Napoleon Hill

1424.quote: All you need in this life is ignorance and confidence, and then success is sure.
1424.author: Mark Twain

1425.quote: When love and skill work together, expect a masterpiece.
1425.author: John Ruskin

1426.quote: Success is how high you bounce when you hit bottom.
1426.author: George S. Patton

1427.quote: No man succeeds without a good woman behind him. Wife or mother, if it is both, he is twice blessed indeed.
1427.author: Godfrey Winn

1428.quote: It is no use saying, 'We are doing our best.' You have got to succeed in doing what is necessary.
1428.author: Winston Churchill

1429.quote: Strive not to be a success, but rather to be of value.
1429.author: Albert Einstein

1431.quote: Man needs his difficulties because they are necessary to enjoy success.
1431.author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

1432.quote: Success is not measured by what you accomplish, but by the opposition you have encountered, and the courage with which you have maintained the struggle against overwhelming odds.
1432.author: Orison Swett Marden

1433.quote: The most important single ingredient in the formula of success is knowing how to get along with people.
1433.author: Theodore Roosevelt

1434.quote: I've failed over and over and over again in my life and that is why I succeed.
1434.author: Michael Jordan

1435.quote: There are people who make things happen, there are people who watch things happen, and there are people who wonder what happened. To be successful, you need to be a person who makes things happen.
1435.author: Jim Lovell

1436.quote: The size of your success is measured by the strength of your desire; the size of your dream; and how you handle disappointment along the way.
1436.author: Robert Kiyosaki

1437.quote: Winning isn't everything, it's the only thing.
1437.author: Vince Lombardi

1438.quote: What's money? A man is a success if he gets up in the morning and goes to bed at night and in between does what he wants to do.
1438.author: Bob Dylan

1439.quote: Success is achieved and maintained by those who try and keep trying.
1439.author: W. Clement Stone

1440.quote: I have learned that success is to be measured not so much by the position that one has reached in life as by the obstacles which he has had to overcome while trying to succeed.
1440.author: Booker T. Washington

1441.quote: There is only one success - to be able to spend your life in your own way.
1441.author: Christopher Morley

1442.quote: Success is finding satisfaction in giving a little more than you take.
1442.author: Christopher Reeve

1443.quote: Always bear in mind that your own resolution to succeed is more important than any other.
1443.author: Abraham Lincoln

1444.quote: The ladder of success is best climbed by stepping on the rungs of opportunity.
1444.author: Ayn Rand

1445.quote: To be prepared is half the victory.
1445.author: Miguel de Cervantes

1446.quote: The difference between a successful person and others is not a lack of strength, not a lack of knowledge, but rather a lack of will.
1446.author: Vince Lombardi

1447.quote: In order to attain the impossible, one must attempt the absurd.
1447.author: Miguel de Cervantes

1448.quote: If you find it in your heart to care for somebody else, you will have succeeded.
1448.author: Maya Angelou

1449.quote: Success makes so many people hate you. I wish it wasn't that way. It would be wonderful to enjoy success without seeing envy in the eyes of those around you.
1449.author: Marilyn Monroe

1450.quote: Success or failure depends more upon attitude than upon capacity successful men act as though they have accomplished or are enjoying something. Soon it becomes a reality. Act, look, feel successful, conduct yourself accordingly, and you will be amazed at the positive results.
1450.author: William James

1451.quote: The foundation stones for a balanced success are honesty, character, integrity, faith, love and loyalty.
1451.author: Zig Ziglar

1452.quote: To be successful, you have to have your heart in your business and your business in your heart.
1452.author: Thomas J. Watson

1453.quote: The real secret of success is enthusiasm.
1453.author: Walter Chrysler

1454.quote: There is no success without hardship.
1454.author: Sophocles

1455.quote: Don't confuse fame with success. Madonna is one; Helen Keller is the other.
1455.author: Erma Bombeck

1456.quote: The successful man will profit from his mistakes and try again in a different way.
1456.author: Dale Carnegie

1457.quote: Success is not a good teacher, failure makes you humble.
1457.author: Shah Rukh Khan

1458.quote: Success depends upon previous preparation, and without such preparation there is sure to be failure.
1458.author: Confucius

1459.quote: Formal education will make you a living; self-education will make you a fortune.
1459.author: Jim Rohn

1460.quote: What is success? I think it is a mixture of having a flair for the thing that you are doing; knowing that it is not enough, that you have got to have hard work and a certain sense of purpose.
1460.author: Margaret Thatcher

1461.quote: Success is to be measured not so much by the position that one has reached in life as by the obstacles which he has overcome.
1461.author: Booker T. Washington

1462.quote: There is little success where there is little laughter.
1462.author: Andrew Carnegie

1463.quote: The five essential entrepreneurial skills for success: Concentration, Discrimination, Organization, Innovation and Communication.
1463.author: Harold S. Geneen

1464.quote: You don't have to be a genius or a visionary or even a college graduate to be successful. You just need a framework and a dream.
1464.author: Michael Dell

1465.quote: It had long since come to my attention that people of accomplishment rarely sat back and let things happen to them. They went out and happened to things.
1465.author: Leonardo da Vinci

1466.quote: Do you wish to rise? Begin by descending. You plan a tower that will pierce the clouds? Lay first the foundation of humility.
1466.author: Saint Augustine

1467.quote: Success isn't measured by money or power or social rank. Success is measured by your discipline and inner peace.
1467.author: Mike Ditka

1468.quote: Invincibility lies in the defence; the possibility of victory in the attack.
1468.author: Sun Tzu

1469.quote: Success is a science; if you have the conditions, you get the result.
1469.author: Oscar Wilde

1470.quote: Success is counted sweetest by those who never succeed.
1470.author: Emily Dickinson

1471.quote: Success is peace of mind which is a direct result of self-satisfaction in knowing you did your best to become the best you are capable of becoming.
1471.author: John Wooden

1472.quote: If you have no critics you'll likely have no success.
1472.author: Malcolm X

1473.quote: Success is falling nine times and getting up ten.
1473.author: Jon Bon Jovi

1474.quote: The toughest thing about success is that you've got to keep on being a success.
1474.author: Irving Berlin

1475.quote: Sometimes I worry about being a success in a mediocre world.
1475.author: Lily Tomlin

1476.quote: It's the steady, quiet, plodding ones who win in the lifelong race.
1476.author: Robert W. Service

1477.quote: The secrets of success are a good wife and a steady job. My wife told me.
1477.author: Howard Nemerov

1478.quote: Our worldly successes cannot be guaranteed, but our ability to achieve spiritual success is entirely up to us, thanks to the grace of God. The best advice I know is to give is to give those worldly things your best but never your all - reserve the ultimate hope for the only one who can grant it.
1478.author: Mitt Romney

1479.quote: Success consists of getting up just one more time than you fall.
1479.author: Oliver Goldsmith

1480.quote: The secret of success is to be in harmony with existence, to be always calm to let each wave of life wash us a little farther up the shore.
1480.author: Cyril Connolly

1482.quote: Success is blocked by concentrating on it and planning for it... Success is shy - it won't come out while you're watching.
1482.author: Tennessee Williams

1483.quote: Failure is not an option. Everyone has to succeed.
1483.author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

1484.quote: Eighty percent of success is showing up.
1484.author: Woody Allen

1485.quote: Develop success from failures. Discouragement and failure are two of the surest stepping stones to success.
1485.author: Dale Carnegie

1486.quote: Formula for success: rise early, work hard, strike oil.
1486.author: J. Paul Getty

1487.quote: Defeat is not the worst of failures. Not to have tried is the true failure.
1487.author: George Edward Woodberry

1488.quote: The greatest sign of success for a teacher... is to be able to say, 'The children are now working as if I did not exist.'
1488.author: Maria Montessori

1489.quote: Most people give up just when they're about to achieve success. They quit on the one yard line. They give up at the last minute of the game one foot from a winning touchdown.
1489.author: Ross Perot

1490.quote: Whosoever desires constant success must change his conduct with the times.
1490.author: Niccolo Machiavelli

1491.quote: In this world it is not what we take up, but what we give up, that makes us rich.
1491.author: Henry Ward Beecher

1492.quote: Those who have succeeded at anything and don't mention luck are kidding themselves.
1492.author: Larry King

1493.quote: The secret of my success is a two word answer: Know people.
1493.author: Harvey S. Firestone

1494.quote: We should measure welfare's success by how many people leave welfare, not by how many are added.
1494.author: Ronald Reagan

1495.quote: People think that at the top there isn't much room. They tend to think of it as an Everest. My message is that there is tons of room at the top.
1495.author: Margaret Thatcher

1497.quote: Once you agree upon the price you and your family must pay for success, it enables you to ignore the minor hurts, the opponent's pressure, and the temporary failures.
1497.author: Vince Lombardi

1498.quote: All men's gains are the fruit of venturing.
1498.author: Herodotus

1499.quote: Definiteness of purpose is the starting point of all achievement.
1499.author: W. Clement Stone

1500.quote: If you want to achieve things in life, you've just got to do them, and if you're talented and smart, you'll succeed.
1500.author: Juliana Hatfield

1501.quote: The thermometer of success is merely the jealousy of the malcontents.
1501.author: Salvador Dali

1502.quote: Success is sweet and sweeter if long delayed and gotten through many struggles and defeats.
1502.author: Amos Bronson Alcott

1503.quote: I was obliged to be industrious. Whoever is equally industrious will succeed equally well.
1503.author: Johann Sebastian Bach

1504.quote: Success is often the result of taking a misstep in the right direction.
1504.author: Al Bernstein

1505.quote: If at first you don't succeed, try, try again. Then quit. There's no point in being a damn fool about it.
1505.author: W. C. Fields

1506.quote: He has achieved success who has worked well, laughed often, and loved much.
1506.author: Elbert Hubbard

1507.quote: Pray that success will not come any faster than you are able to endure it.
1507.author: Elbert Hubbard

1508.quote: The common idea that success spoils people by making them vain, egotistic and self-complacent is erroneous; on the contrary it makes them, for the most part, humble, tolerant and kind.
1508.author: W. Somerset Maugham

1510.quote: Success is not forever and failure isn't fatal.
1510.author: Don Shula

1511.quote: The man who has done his level best... is a success, even though the world may write him down a failure.
1511.author: B. C. Forbes

1512.quote: Let me tell you the secret that has led me to my goal. My strength lies solely in my tenacity.
1512.author: Louis Pasteur

1513.quote: Success in almost any field depends more on energy and drive than it does on intelligence. This explains why we have so many stupid leaders.
1513.author: Sloan Wilson

1514.quote: If you want to be truly successful invest in yourself to get the knowledge you need to find your unique factor. When you find it and focus on it and persevere your success will blossom.
1514.author: Sydney Madwed

1515.quote: A person with a new idea is a crank until the idea succeeds.
1515.author: Mark Twain

1516.quote: Success comes from knowing that you did your best to become the best that you are capable of becoming.
1516.author: John Wooden

1517.quote: One secret of success in life is for a man to be ready for his opportunity when it comes.
1517.author: Benjamin Disraeli

1518.quote: Success is the child of drudgery and perseverance. It cannot be coaxed or bribed; pay the price and it is yours.
1518.author: Orison Swett Marden

1519.quote: Flaming enthusiasm, backed up by horse sense and persistence, is the quality that most frequently makes for success.
1519.author: Dale Carnegie

1520.quote: If you wish to succeed in life, make perseverance your bosom friend, experience your wise counselor, caution your elder brother, and hope your guardian genius.
1520.author: Joseph Addison

1521.quote: God lets you be successful because he trusts you that you will do the right thing with it. Now, does he get disappointed often? All the time, because people get there and they forget how they got it.
1521.author: Steve Harvey

1522.quote: They succeed, because they think they can.
1522.author: Virgil

1523.quote: Failure is success if we learn from it.
1523.author: Malcolm Forbes

1524.quote: Whatever success I may have attained is due to the fact that since I was old enough to work at all, my ambition has never deserted me.
1524.author: Anna Held

1525.quote: Success - keeping your mind awake and your desire asleep.
1525.author: Walter Scott

1526.quote: Winning isn't everything, but it beats anything in second place.
1526.author: William C. Bryant

1527.quote: Success is a state of mind. If you want success, start thinking of yourself as a success.
1527.author: Joyce Brothers

1528.quote: Belief in oneself is one of the most important bricks in building any successful venture.
1528.author: Lydia M. Child

1529.quote: The measure of success is not whether you have a tough problem to deal with, but whether it is the same problem you had last year.
1529.author: John Foster Dulles

1530.quote: As kids we're not taught how to deal with success; we're taught how to deal with failure. If at first you don't succeed, try, try again. If at first you succeed, then what?
1530.author: Charlie Sheen

1531.quote: Frustration, although quite painful at times, is a very positive and essential part of success.
1531.author: Bo Bennett

1532.quote: Success has a simple formula: do your best, and people may like it.
1532.author: Sam Ewing

1533.quote: Success is getting what you want. Happiness is wanting what you get.
1533.author: Dale Carnegie

1534.quote: Do something you really like, and hopefully it pays the rent. As far as I'm concerned, that's success.
1534.author: Tom Petty

1535.quote: The secret of success is sincerity.
1535.author: Jean Giraudoux

1536.quote: Victory has a thousand fathers, but defeat is an orphan.
1536.author: John F. Kennedy

1537.quote: To be successful you have to be lucky, or a little mad, or very talented, or find yourself in a rapid growth field.
1537.author: Edward de Bono

1538.quote: Success isn't a result of spontaneous combustion. You must set yourself on fire.
1538.author: Arnold H. Glasow

1539.quote: Success is simply a matter of luck. Ask any failure.
1539.author: Earl Wilson

1540.quote: In a balanced organization, working towards a common objective, there is success.
1540.author: Arthur Helps

1541.quote: I honestly think it is better to be a failure at something you love than to be a success at something you hate.
1541.author: George Burns

1542.quote: To know even one life has breathed easier because you have lived. This is to have succeeded.
1542.author: Bessie Anderson Stanley

1543.quote: Success is like reaching an important birthday and finding you're exactly the same.
1543.author: Audrey Hepburn

1545.quote: The one thing that I know is that you win with good people.
1545.author: Don Shula

1546.quote: Success is that old ABC - ability, breaks, and courage.
1546.author: Charles Luckman

1547.quote: Success isn't everything but it makes a man stand straight.
1547.author: Lillian Hellman

1549.quote: A champion is afraid of losing. Everyone else is afraid of winning.
1549.author: Billie Jean King

1550.quote: Obedience is the mother of success and is wedded to safety.
1550.author: Aeschylus

1551.quote: Prospering just doesn't have to do with money.
1551.author: Joel Osteen

1552.quote: There is no substitute for victory.
1552.author: Douglas MacArthur

1554.quote: Success doesn't mean that you are healthy, success doesn't mean that you're happy, success doesn't mean that you're rested. Success really doesn't mean that you look good, or feel good, or are good.
1554.author: Victoria Principal

1555.quote: Success is the one unpardonable sin against our fellows.
1555.author: Ambrose Bierce

1556.quote: I don't think about financial success as the measurement of my success.
1556.author: Christie Hefner

1557.quote: After I won the Oscar, my salary doubled, my friends tripled, my children became more popular at school, my butcher made a pass at me, and my maid hit me up for a raise.
1557.author: Shirley Jones

1558.quote: Success is the space one occupies in the newspaper. Success is one day's insolence.
1558.author: Elias Canetti

1559.quote: In order to succeed you must fail, so that you know what not to do the next time.
1559.author: Anthony J. D'Angelo

1560.quote: Success seems to be largely a matter of hanging on after others have let go.
1560.author: William Feather

1562.quote: Diligence is the mother of good fortune.
1562.author: Benjamin Disraeli

1563.quote: It's our nature: Human beings like success but they hate successful people.
1563.author: Carrot Top

1564.quote: To design the future effectively, you must first let go of your past.
1564.author: Charles J. Givens

1565.quote: Success is the progressive realization of predetermined, worthwhile, personal goals.
1565.author: Paul J. Meyer

1566.quote: Success is like death. The more successful you become, the higher the houses in the hills get and the higher the fences get.
1566.author: Kevin Spacey

1567.quote: The victor belongs to the spoils.
1567.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

1568.quote: The success and the failure are not my concern, but His.
1568.author: Joseph Barber Lightfoot

1569.quote: Can you imagine what I would do if I could do all I can?
1569.author: Jeff Rich

1570.quote: It's not enough that I should succeed - others should fail.
1570.author: David Merrick

1571.quote: The one phrase you can use is that success has a thousand fathers, and failure is an orphan.
1571.author: Alan Price

1572.quote: How can they say my life is not a success? Have I not for more than sixty years got enough to eat and escaped being eaten?
1572.author: Logan Pearsall Smith

1574.quote: Success to me is having ten honeydew melons and eating only the top half of each slice.
1574.author: Barbra Streisand

1575.quote: From success you get a lot of things, but not that great inside thing that love brings you.
1575.author: Samuel Goldwyn

1576.quote: Put your heart, mind, and soul into even your smallest acts. This is the secret of success.
1576.author: Swami Sivananda

1577.quote: Ultimately, leadership is not about glorious crowning acts. It's about keeping your team focused on a goal and motivated to do their best to achieve it, especially when the stakes are high and the consequences really matter. It is about laying the groundwork for others' success, and then standing back and letting them shine.
1577.author: Chris Hadfield

1578.quote: Success is the result of perfection, hard work, learning from failure, loyalty, and persistence.
1578.author: Colin Powell

1579.quote: The road to success is not easy to navigate, but with hard work, drive and passion, it's possible to achieve the American dream.
1579.author: Tommy Hilfiger

1580.quote: My mother was the most beautiful woman I ever saw. All I am I owe to my mother. I attribute all my success in life to the moral, intellectual and physical education I received from her.
1580.author: George Washington

1581.quote: Success is no accident. It is hard work, perseverance, learning, studying, sacrifice and most of all, love of what you are doing or learning to do.
1581.author: Pele

1582.quote: A strong, positive self-image is the best possible preparation for success.
1582.author: Joyce Brothers

1583.quote: There are no secrets to success. It is the result of preparation, hard work, and learning from failure.
1583.author: Colin Powell

1584.quote: Success is not a destination, but the road that you're on. Being successful means that you're working hard and walking your walk every day. You can only live your dream by working hard towards it. That's living your dream.
1584.author: Marlon Wayans

1585.quote: Character cannot be developed in ease and quiet. Only through experience of trial and suffering can the soul be strengthened, ambition inspired, and success achieved.
1585.author: Helen Keller

1586.quote: It's fine to celebrate success but it is more important to heed the lessons of failure.
1586.author: Bill Gates

1587.quote: For success, attitude is equally as important as ability.
1587.author: Walter Scott

1588.quote: Without continual growth and progress, such words as improvement, achievement, and success have no meaning.
1588.author: Benjamin Franklin

1589.quote: Failure is the key to success; each mistake teaches us something.
1589.author: Morihei Ueshiba

1590.quote: Humility is the true key to success. Successful people lose their way at times. They often embrace and overindulge from the fruits of success. Humility halts this arrogance and self-indulging trap. Humble people share the credit and wealth, remaining focused and hungry to continue the journey of success.
1590.author: Rick Pitino

1591.quote: Education is the key to success in life, and teachers make a lasting impact in the lives of their students.
1591.author: Solomon Ortiz

1592.quote: Every day is a new opportunity. You can build on yesterday's success or put its failures behind and start over again. That's the way life is, with a new game every day, and that's the way baseball is.
1592.author: Bob Feller

1593.quote: Honesty and loyalty are key. If two people can be honest with each other about everything, that's probably the biggest key to success.
1593.author: Taylor Lautner

1594.quote: The supreme quality for leadership is unquestionably integrity. Without it, no real success is possible, no matter whether it is on a section gang, a football field, in an army, or in an office.
1594.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

1595.quote: We learned about honesty and integrity - that the truth matters... that you don't take shortcuts or play by your own set of rules... and success doesn't count unless you earn it fair and square.
1595.author: Michelle Obama

1596.quote: Your success and happiness lies in you. Resolve to keep happy, and your joy and you shall form an invincible host against difficulties.
1596.author: Helen Keller

1597.quote: The only place success comes before work is in the dictionary.
1597.author: Vince Lombardi

1598.quote: The way a team plays as a whole determines its success. You may have the greatest bunch of individual stars in the world, but if they don't play together, the club won't be worth a dime.
1598.author: Babe Ruth

1599.quote: Success is almost totally dependent upon drive and persistence. The extra energy required to make another effort or try another approach is the secret of winning.
1599.author: Denis Waitley

1600.quote: Money won't create success, the freedom to make it will.
1600.author: Nelson Mandela

1601.quote: I attribute my success to this - I never gave or took any excuse.
1601.author: Florence Nightingale

1602.quote: Communication - the human connection - is the key to personal and career success.
1602.author: Paul J. Meyer

1603.quote: If one advances confidently in the direction of his dreams, and endeavors to live the life which he has imagined, he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours.
1603.author: Henry David Thoreau

1604.quote: Success is where preparation and opportunity meet.
1604.author: Bobby Unser

1605.quote: Let every nation know, whether it wishes us well or ill, that we shall pay any price, bear any burden, meet any hardship, support any friend, oppose any foe to assure the survival and the success of liberty.
1605.author: John F. Kennedy

1606.quote: Ambition is the path to success. Persistence is the vehicle you arrive in.
1606.author: Bill Bradley

1607.quote: Patience, persistence and perspiration make an unbeatable combination for success.
1607.author: Napoleon Hill

1608.quote: Learning and innovation go hand in hand. The arrogance of success is to think that what you did yesterday will be sufficient for tomorrow.
1608.author: William Pollard

1609.quote: Success is only meaningful and enjoyable if it feels like your own.
1609.author: Michelle Obama

1610.quote: Desire is the key to motivation, but it's the determination and commitment to unrelenting pursuit of your goal - a commitment to excellence - that will enable you to attain the success you seek.
1610.author: Mario Andretti

1611.quote: At the end of the day, the most overwhelming key to a child's success is the positive involvement of parents.
1611.author: Jane D. Hull

1612.quote: Growing up in a group home, and with an undiagnosed learning disability to boot, the odds of success were not on my side. But when I joined the high school football team, I learned the value of discipline, focus, persistence, and teamwork - all skills that have proven vital to my career as a C.E.O. and social entrepreneur.
1612.author: Darell Hammond

1613.quote: If you want to succeed you should strike out on new paths, rather than travel the worn paths of accepted success.
1613.author: John D. Rockefeller

1614.quote: The best revenge is massive success.
1614.author: Frank Sinatra

1615.quote: Part of the secret of a success in life is to eat what you like and let the food fight it out inside.
1615.author: Mark Twain

1616.quote: The secret of your success is determined by your daily agenda.
1616.author: John C. Maxwell

1617.quote: Success is not built on success. It's built on failure. It's built on frustration. Sometimes its built on catastrophe.
1617.author: Sumner Redstone

1618.quote: Focused, hard work is the real key to success. Keep your eyes on the goal, and just keep taking the next step towards completing it. If you aren't sure which way to do something, do it both ways and see which works better.
1618.author: John Carmack

1619.quote: Socialism has no moral justification whatsoever; poor people are not morally superior to rich people, nor are they owed anything by rich people simply because of their lack of success. Charity is not a socialist concept - it is a religious one, an acknowledgment of God's sovereignty over property, a sovereignty the Left utterly rejects.
1619.author: Ben Shapiro

1620.quote: A little more persistence, a little more effort, and what seemed hopeless failure may turn to glorious success.
1620.author: Elbert Hubbard

1621.quote: Just remember, you can't climb the ladder of success with your hands in your pockets.
1621.author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

1622.quote: The secret of success is learning how to use pain and pleasure instead of having pain and pleasure use you. If you do that, you're in control of your life. If you don't, life controls you.
1622.author: Tony Robbins

1623.quote: The secret to success is good leadership, and good leadership is all about making the lives of your team members or workers better.
1623.author: Tony Dungy

1624.quote: Earn your success based on service to others, not at the expense of others.
1624.author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

1625.quote: The road to success is always under construction.
1625.author: Arnold Palmer

1626.quote: Success breeds complacency. Complacency breeds failure. Only the paranoid survive.
1626.author: Andy Grove

1627.quote: The battle of life is, in most cases, fought uphill; and to win it without a struggle were perhaps to win it without honor. If there were no difficulties there would be no success; if there were nothing to struggle for, there would be nothing to be achieved.
1627.author: Samuel Smiles

1628.quote: Your positive action combined with positive thinking results in success.
1628.author: Shiv Khera

1629.quote: It's how you deal with failure that determines how you achieve success.
1629.author: Charlotte Whitton

1630.quote: If I write a book where all I've ever experienced is success, people won't take a positive lesson from it. In being candid, I have to own up to my own failures, both in my marriage and in my work environment.
1630.author: Sonia Sotomayor

1631.quote: That some achieve great success, is proof to all that others can achieve it as well.
1631.author: Abraham Lincoln

1632.quote: Management is efficiency in climbing the ladder of success; leadership determines whether the ladder is leaning against the right wall.
1632.author: Stephen Covey

1633.quote: Never continue in a job you don't enjoy. If you're happy in what you're doing, you'll like yourself, you'll have inner peace. And if you have that, along with physical health, you will have had more success than you could possibly have imagined.
1633.author: Johnny Carson

1634.quote: I believe that one key to success is to accept truth, no matter how it's spoken.
1634.author: Robert Kiyosaki

1635.quote: The definition of success to me is not necessarily a price tag, not fame, but having a good life, and being able to say I did the right thing at the end of the day.
1635.author: Jeremy Luke

1636.quote: The new midlife is where you realize that even your failures make you more beautiful and are turned spiritually into success if you became a better person because of them. You became a more humble person. You became a more merciful and compassionate person.
1636.author: Marianne Williamson

1637.quote: The season of failure is the best time for sowing the seeds of success.
1637.author: Paramahansa Yogananda

1638.quote: Love is the only force capable of transforming an enemy into friend.
1638.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

1639.quote: There is nothing on this earth more to be prized than true friendship.
1639.author: Thomas Aquinas

1640.quote: The greatest gift of life is friendship, and I have received it.
1640.author: Hubert H. Humphrey

1641.quote: One of the most beautiful qualities of true friendship is to understand and to be understood.
1641.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

1642.quote: Friends show their love in times of trouble, not in happiness.
1642.author: Euripides

1643.quote: Walking with a friend in the dark is better than walking alone in the light.
1643.author: Helen Keller

1644.quote: A real friend is one who walks in when the rest of the world walks out.
1644.author: Walter Winchell

1645.quote: A friend is what the heart needs all the time.
1645.author: Henry Van Dyke

1646.quote: I cannot even imagine where I would be today were it not for that handful of friends who have given me a heart full of joy. Let's face it, friends make life a lot more fun.
1646.author: Charles R. Swindoll

1647.quote: Friendship is always a sweet responsibility, never an opportunity.
1647.author: Khalil Gibran

1648.quote: True friendship multiplies the good in life and divides its evils. Strive to have friends, for life without friends is like life on a desert island... to find one real friend in a lifetime is good fortune; to keep him is a blessing.
1648.author: Baltasar Gracian

1649.quote: Remember that the most valuable antiques are dear old friends.
1649.author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

1650.quote: Friendship... is not something you learn in school. But if you haven't learned the meaning of friendship, you really haven't learned anything.
1650.author: Muhammad Ali

1651.quote: A single rose can be my garden... a single friend, my world.
1651.author: Leo Buscaglia

1652.quote: My best friend is the one who brings out the best in me.
1652.author: Henry Ford

1653.quote: Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend.
1653.author: Albert Camus

1654.quote: Friends are the siblings God never gave us.
1654.author: Mencius

1655.quote: It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them.
1655.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

1656.quote: A friend is someone who gives you total freedom to be yourself.
1656.author: Jim Morrison

1657.quote: One loyal friend is worth ten thousand relatives.
1657.author: Euripides

1658.quote: Sometimes being a friend means mastering the art of timing. There is a time for silence. A time to let go and allow people to hurl themselves into their own destiny. And a time to prepare to pick up the pieces when it's all over.
1658.author: Octavia Butler

1659.quote: Rare as is true love, true friendship is rarer.
1659.author: Jean de La Fontaine

1660.quote: In the sweetness of friendship let there be laughter, and sharing of pleasures. For in the dew of little things the heart finds its morning and is refreshed.
1660.author: Khalil Gibran

1661.quote: When we honestly ask ourselves which person in our lives means the most to us, we often find that it is those who, instead of giving advice, solutions, or cures, have chosen rather to share our pain and touch our wounds with a warm and tender hand.
1661.author: Henri Nouwen

1662.quote: There are no strangers here; Only friends you haven't yet met.
1662.author: William Butler Yeats

1663.quote: My best friend is the man who in wishing me well wishes it for my sake.
1663.author: Aristotle

1664.quote: Friends and good manners will carry you where money won't go.
1664.author: Margaret Walker

1665.quote: The language of friendship is not words but meanings.
1665.author: Henry David Thoreau

1666.quote: Things are never quite as scary when you've got a best friend.
1666.author: Bill Watterson

1667.quote: Let us be grateful to people who make us happy, they are the charming gardeners who make our souls blossom.
1667.author: Marcel Proust

1668.quote: A true friend is the greatest of all blessings, and that which we take the least care of all to acquire.
1668.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

1669.quote: Since there is nothing so well worth having as friends, never lose a chance to make them.
1669.author: Francesco Guicciardini

1670.quote: A friend to all is a friend to none.
1670.author: Aristotle

1671.quote: A friend is one who knows you and loves you just the same.
1671.author: Elbert Hubbard

1672.quote: The most I can do for my friend is simply be his friend.
1672.author: Henry David Thoreau

1673.quote: In everyone's life, at some time, our inner fire goes out. It is then burst into flame by an encounter with another human being. We should all be thankful for those people who rekindle the inner spirit.
1673.author: Albert Schweitzer

1674.quote: True friends stab you in the front.
1674.author: Oscar Wilde

1675.quote: I never considered a difference of opinion in politics, in religion, in philosophy, as cause for withdrawing from a friend.
1675.author: Thomas Jefferson

1676.quote: I have learned that to be with those I like is enough.
1676.author: Walt Whitman

1677.quote: Laughter is not at all a bad beginning for a friendship, and it is far the best ending for one.
1677.author: Oscar Wilde

1678.quote: Friendship is unnecessary, like philosophy, like art... It has no survival value; rather it is one of those things that give value to survival.
1678.author: C. S. Lewis

1680.quote: A man's friendships are one of the best measures of his worth.
1680.author: Charles Darwin

1681.quote: Yes'm, old friends is always best, 'less you can catch a new one that's fit to make an old one out of.
1681.author: Sarah Orne Jewett

1682.quote: The only way to have a friend is to be one.
1682.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

1683.quote: A true friend never gets in your way unless you happen to be going down.
1683.author: Arnold H. Glasow

1684.quote: Friends... they cherish one another's hopes. They are kind to one another's dreams.
1684.author: Henry David Thoreau

1685.quote: The world is round so that friendship may encircle it.
1685.author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin

1686.quote: Many a friendship, long, loyal, and self-sacrificing, rested at first on no thicker a foundation than a kind word.
1686.author: Frederick William Faber

1687.quote: The best time to make friends is before you need them.
1687.author: Ethel Barrymore

1688.quote: It is only the great hearted who can be true friends. The mean and cowardly, Can never know what true friendship means.
1688.author: Charles Kingsley

1689.quote: True friendship is like sound health; the value of it is seldom known until it is lost.
1689.author: Charles Caleb Colton

1690.quote: Love is blind; friendship closes its eyes.
1690.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

1691.quote: Friendship is one mind in two bodies.
1691.author: Mencius

1692.quote: Each friend represents a world in us, a world not born until they arrive, and it is only by this meeting that a new world is born.
1692.author: Anais Nin

1693.quote: Friendship is the source of the greatest pleasures, and without friends even the most agreeable pursuits become tedious.
1693.author: Thomas Aquinas

1694.quote: Never make friends with people who are above or below you in status. Such friendships will never give you any happiness.
1694.author: Chanakya

1695.quote: Friendship will not stand the strain of very much good advice for very long.
1695.author: Robert Staughton Lynd

1696.quote: The sincere friends of this world are as ship lights in the stormiest of nights.
1696.author: Giotto di Bondone

1697.quote: But friendship is precious, not only in the shade, but in the sunshine of life, and thanks to a benevolent arrangement the greater part of life is sunshine.
1697.author: Thomas Jefferson

1698.quote: Friendship at first sight, like love at first sight, is said to be the only truth.
1698.author: Herman Melville

1699.quote: A true friend is one who overlooks your failures and tolerates your success!
1699.author: Doug Larson

1700.quote: Be slow in choosing a friend, slower in changing.
1700.author: Benjamin Franklin

1701.quote: Friendship improves happiness and abates misery, by the doubling of our joy and the dividing of our grief.
1701.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

1702.quote: It is more shameful to distrust our friends than to be deceived by them.
1702.author: Confucius

1703.quote: She is a friend of mind. She gather me, man. The pieces I am, she gather them and give them back to me in all the right order. It's good, you know, when you got a woman who is a friend of your mind.
1703.author: Toni Morrison

1704.quote: Your friend is your needs answered.
1704.author: Khalil Gibran

1705.quote: A friend is a gift you give yourself.
1705.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

1706.quote: The friend who can be silent with us in a moment of despair or confusion, who can stay with us in an hour of grief and bereavement, who can tolerate not knowing... not healing, not curing... that is a friend who cares.
1706.author: Henri Nouwen

1707.quote: A friendship can weather most things and thrive in thin soil; but it needs a little mulch of letters and phone calls and small, silly presents every so often - just to save it from drying out completely.
1707.author: Pam Brown

1709.quote: A friend in power is a friend lost.
1709.author: Henry Adams

1710.quote: A friend is, as it were, a second self.
1710.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

1711.quote: I have friends in overalls whose friendship I would not swap for the favor of the kings of the world.
1711.author: Thomas A. Edison

1712.quote: Without wearing any mask we are conscious of, we have a special face for each friend.
1712.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

1713.quote: Wishing to be friends is quick work, but friendship is a slow ripening fruit.
1713.author: Aristotle

1714.quote: You win the victory when you yield to friends.
1714.author: Sophocles

1715.quote: Sweet is the memory of distant friends! Like the mellow rays of the departing sun, it falls tenderly, yet sadly, on the heart.
1715.author: Washington Irving

1716.quote: There is a magnet in your heart that will attract true friends. That magnet is unselfishness, thinking of others first; when you learn to live for others, they will live for you.
1716.author: Paramahansa Yogananda

1717.quote: False friendship, like the ivy, decays and ruins the walls it embraces; but true friendship gives new life and animation to the object it supports.
1717.author: Richard Burton

1718.quote: Friendship is a word, the very sight of which in print makes the heart warm.
1718.author: Augustine Birrell

1719.quote: Be slow to fall into friendship; but when thou art in, continue firm and constant.
1719.author: Socrates

1720.quote: It seems to me that trying to live without friends is like milking a bear to get cream for your morning coffee. It is a whole lot of trouble, and then not worth much after you get it.
1720.author: Zora Neale Hurston

1721.quote: That friendship will not continue to the end which is begun for an end.
1721.author: Francis Quarles

1722.quote: An excellent man; he has no enemies; and none of his friends like him.
1722.author: Oscar Wilde

1723.quote: No person is your friend who demands your silence, or denies your right to grow.
1723.author: Alice Walker

1724.quote: The bird a nest, the spider a web, man friendship.
1724.author: William Blake

1725.quote: Men kick friendship around like a football, but it doesn't seem to crack. Women treat it like glass and it goes to pieces.
1725.author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

1726.quote: A true friend is someone who is there for you when he'd rather be anywhere else.
1726.author: Len Wein

1727.quote: A friendship founded on business is better than a business founded on friendship.
1727.author: John D. Rockefeller

1728.quote: Nothing but heaven itself is better than a friend who is really a friend.
1728.author: Plautus

1729.quote: Lots of people want to ride with you in the limo, but what you want is someone who will take the bus with you when the limo breaks down.
1729.author: Oprah Winfrey

1730.quote: It is not so much our friends' help that helps us, as the confidence of their help.
1730.author: Epicurus

1731.quote: Friends are the best to turn to when you're having a rough day.
1731.author: Justin Bieber

1732.quote: When friendship disappears then there is a space left open to that awful loneliness of the outside world which is like the cold space between the planets. It is an air in which men perish utterly.
1732.author: Hilaire Belloc

1733.quote: Two persons cannot long be friends if they cannot forgive each other's little failings.
1733.author: Jean de la Bruyere

1734.quote: Of all possessions a friend is the most precious.
1734.author: Herodotus

1735.quote: The real test of friendship is: can you literally do nothing with the other person? Can you enjoy those moments of life that are utterly simple?
1735.author: Eugene Kennedy

1736.quote: We call that person who has lost his father, an orphan; and a widower that man who has lost his wife. But that man who has known the immense unhappiness of losing a friend, by what name do we call him? Here every language is silent and holds its peace in impotence.
1736.author: Joseph Roux

1737.quote: When a friend is in trouble, don't annoy him by asking if there is anything you can do. Think up something appropriate and do it.
1737.author: E. W. Howe

1738.quote: Never contract friendship with a man that is not better than thyself.
1738.author: Confucius

1739.quote: Lovers have a right to betray you... friends don't.
1739.author: Judy Holliday

1740.quote: Friendship multiplies the good of life and divides the evil.
1740.author: Baltasar Gracian

1741.quote: Love demands infinitely less than friendship.
1741.author: George Jean Nathan

1742.quote: Our friends interpret the world and ourselves to us, if we take them tenderly and truly.
1742.author: Amos Bronson Alcott

1743.quote: How delightful to find a friend in everyone.
1743.author: Joseph Brodsky

1744.quote: A friend may well be reckoned the masterpiece of nature.
1744.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

1745.quote: A man's growth is seen in the successive choirs of his friends.
1745.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

1746.quote: Let there be no purpose in friendship save the deepening of the spirit.
1746.author: Khalil Gibran

1747.quote: Be courteous to all, but intimate with few, and let those few be well tried before you give them your confidence.
1747.author: George Washington

1748.quote: I want my friend to miss me as long as I miss him.
1748.author: Saint Augustine

1749.quote: Where would you be without friends? The people to pick you up when you need lifting? We come from homes far from perfect, so you end up almost parent and sibling to your friends - your own chosen family. There's nothing like a really loyal, dependable, good friend. Nothing.
1749.author: Jennifer Aniston

1750.quote: Remember that a gesture of friendship, no matter how small, is always appreciated.
1750.author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

1751.quote: Friendship marks a life even more deeply than love. Love risks degenerating into obsession, friendship is never anything but sharing.
1751.author: Elie Wiesel

1752.quote: Never explain - your friends do not need it and your enemies will not believe you anyway.
1752.author: Elbert Hubbard

1753.quote: My definition of a friend is somebody who adores you even though they know the things you're most ashamed of.
1753.author: Jodie Foster

1754.quote: But friendship is the breathing rose, with sweets in every fold.
1754.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

1755.quote: Never do a wrong thing to make a friend or to keep one.
1755.author: Robert E. Lee

1756.quote: Instead of loving your enemies - treat your friends a little better.
1756.author: E. W. Howe

1757.quote: There is some self-interest behind every friendship. There is no friendship without self-interests. This is a bitter truth.
1757.author: Chanakya

1758.quote: Friendship needs no words - it is solitude delivered from the anguish of loneliness.
1758.author: Dag Hammarskjold

1759.quote: Our most intimate friend is not he to whom we show the worst, but the best of our nature.
1759.author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

1760.quote: A true friend freely, advises justly, assists readily, adventures boldly, takes all patiently, defends courageously, and continues a friend unchangeably.
1760.author: William Penn

1761.quote: You can always tell a real friend: when you've made a fool of yourself he doesn't feel you've done a permanent job.
1761.author: Laurence J. Peter

1762.quote: A quarrel between friends, when made up, adds a new tie to friendship.
1762.author: Saint Francis de Sales

1763.quote: The friend in my adversity I shall always cherish most. I can better trust those who helped to relieve the gloom of my dark hours than those who are so ready to enjoy with me the sunshine of my prosperity.
1763.author: Ulysses S. Grant

1764.quote: It's the friends you can call up at 4 a.m. that matter.
1764.author: Marlene Dietrich

1765.quote: If instead of a gem, or even a flower, we should cast the gift of a loving thought into the heart of a friend, that would be giving as the angels give.
1765.author: George MacDonald

1766.quote: Lay this unto your breast: Old friends, like old swords, still are trusted best.
1766.author: John Webster

1767.quote: Friendship and money: oil and water.
1767.author: Mario Puzo

1768.quote: Life has no blessing like a prudent friend.
1768.author: Euripides

1769.quote: There is no friend like an old friend who has shared our morning days, no greeting like his welcome, no homage like his praise.
1769.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

1770.quote: To avoid being mistaken for a sellout, I chose my friends carefully. The more politically active black students. The foreign students. The Chicanos. The Marxist professors and structural feminists and punk-rock performance poets.
1770.author: Barack Obama

1771.quote: All you need to do to be my friend is like me.
1771.author: Taylor Swift

1772.quote: If you have one true friend you have more than your share.
1772.author: Thomas Fuller

1773.quote: I don't need a friend who changes when I change and who nods when I nod; my shadow does that much better.
1773.author: Plutarch

1774.quote: You find out who your real friends are when you're involved in a scandal.
1774.author: Elizabeth Taylor

1775.quote: As iron sharpens iron, so a friend sharpens a friend.
1775.author: King Solomon

1776.quote: If it's very painful for you to criticize your friends - you're safe in doing it. But if you take the slightest pleasure in it, that's the time to hold your tongue.
1776.author: Alice Miller

1777.quote: A friend should be one in whose understanding and virtue we can equally confide, and whose opinion we can value at once for its justness and its sincerity.
1777.author: Robert Hall

1778.quote: Do I not destroy my enemies when I make them my friends?
1778.author: Abraham Lincoln

1779.quote: True friendship can afford true knowledge. It does not depend on darkness and ignorance.
1779.author: Henry David Thoreau

1780.quote: An insincere and evil friend is more to be feared than a wild beast; a wild beast may wound your body, but an evil friend will wound your mind.
1780.author: Unknown

1781.quote: It is important to our friends to believe that we are unreservedly frank with them, and important to friendship that we are not.
1781.author: Mignon McLaughlin

1782.quote: Never have a companion that casts you in the shade.
1782.author: Baltasar Gracian

1783.quote: Nothing so fortifies a friendship as a belief on the part of one friend that he is superior to the other.
1783.author: Honore de Balzac

1784.quote: He has no enemies, but is intensely disliked by his friends.
1784.author: Oscar Wilde

1785.quote: When you choose your friends, don't be short-changed by choosing personality over character.
1785.author: W. Somerset Maugham

1786.quote: One's friends are that part of the human race with which one can be human.
1786.author: George Santayana

1787.quote: Many a person has held close, throughout their entire lives, two friends that always remained strange to one another, because one of them attracted by virtue of similarity, the other by difference.
1787.author: Emil Ludwig

1788.quote: Rejoicing in our joy, not suffering over our suffering, makes someone a friend.
1788.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

1789.quote: Mighty proud I am that I am able to have a spare bed for my friends.
1789.author: Samuel Pepys

1790.quote: I always felt that the great high privilege, relief and comfort of friendship was that one had to explain nothing.
1790.author: Katherine Mansfield

1791.quote: Friendship is held to be the severest test of character. It is easy, we think, to be loyal to a family and clan, whose blood is in your own veins.
1791.author: Charles Eastman

1792.quote: Some people go to priests; others to poetry; I to my friends.
1792.author: Virginia Woolf

1793.quote: It takes a long time to grow an old friend.
1793.author: John Leonard

1794.quote: Silences make the real conversations between friends. Not the saying but the never needing to say is what counts.
1794.author: Margaret Lee Runbeck

1795.quote: He who hath many friends hath none.
1795.author: Aristotle

1796.quote: A man cannot be said to succeed in this life who does not satisfy one friend.
1796.author: Henry David Thoreau

1797.quote: Fear makes strangers of people who would be friends.
1797.author: Shirley MacLaine

1798.quote: Love is friendship that has caught fire. It is quiet understanding, mutual confidence, sharing and forgiving. It is loyalty through good and bad times. It settles for less than perfection and makes allowances for human weaknesses.
1798.author: Ann Landers

1799.quote: Be true to yourself, help others, make each day your masterpiece, make friendship a fine art, drink deeply from good books - especially the Bible, build a shelter against a rainy day, give thanks for your blessings and pray for guidance every day.
1799.author: John Wooden
