3273.quote: If you come from a solid family structure, it doesn't matter what you go through in your life. You're going to be okay.
3273.author: Alyssa Milano

3274.quote: I can't say it's not painful being estranged from most of my family. I wish it could be otherwise.
3274.author: LaToya Jackson

3275.quote: Enough is enough. Six years you serve the countries. You been working hard. You sacrifice your time even your life. And, even your family life. So it's, it's time for me to go back as a private citizen. And contribute to the Thai society outside political arena.
3275.author: Thaksin Shinawatra

3276.quote: You must be the change you wish to see in the world.
3276.author: Mahatma Gandhi

3277.quote: Progress is impossible without change, and those who cannot change their minds cannot change anything.
3277.author: George Bernard Shaw

3278.quote: Since we cannot change reality, let us change the eyes which see reality.
3278.author: Nikos Kazantzakis

3279.quote: To improve is to change; to be perfect is to change often.
3279.author: Winston Churchill

3280.quote: Change will not come if we wait for some other person or some other time. We are the ones we've been waiting for. We are the change that we seek.
3280.author: Barack Obama

3281.quote: If you don't like something, change it. If you can't change it, change your attitude.
3281.author: Maya Angelou

3282.quote: Change is the law of life. And those who look only to the past or present are certain to miss the future.
3282.author: John F. Kennedy

3283.quote: If you change the way you look at things, the things you look at change.
3283.author: Wayne Dyer

3284.quote: Without a struggle, there can be no progress.
3284.author: Frederick Douglass

3285.quote: For the past 33 years, I have looked in the mirror every morning and asked myself: 'If today were the last day of my life, would I want to do what I am about to do today?' And whenever the answer has been 'No' for too many days in a row, I know I need to change something.
3285.author: Steve Jobs

3286.quote: Never believe that a few caring people can't change the world. For, indeed, that's all who ever have.
3286.author: Margaret Mead

3287.quote: You must take personal responsibility. You cannot change the circumstances, the seasons, or the wind, but you can change yourself. That is something you have charge of.
3287.author: Jim Rohn

3288.quote: Change does not roll in on the wheels of inevitability, but comes through continuous struggle. And so we must straighten our backs and work for our freedom. A man can't ride you unless your back is bent.
3288.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

3289.quote: If there is no struggle, there is no progress.
3289.author: Frederick Douglass

3290.quote: If you do not change direction, you may end up where you are heading.
3290.author: Lao Tzu

3291.quote: Everyone thinks of changing the world, but no one thinks of changing himself.
3291.author: Leo Tolstoy

3292.quote: They always say time changes things, but you actually have to change them yourself.
3292.author: Andy Warhol

3293.quote: When we are no longer able to change a situation - we are challenged to change ourselves.
3293.author: Viktor E. Frankl

3294.quote: There is nothing permanent except change.
3294.author: Heraclitus

3295.quote: The only way to make sense out of change is to plunge into it, move with it, and join the dance.
3295.author: Alan Watts

3296.quote: It is change, continuing change, inevitable change, that is the dominant factor in society today. No sensible decision can be made any longer without taking into account not only the world as it is, but the world as it will be.
3296.author: Isaac Asimov

3297.quote: Some people don't like change, but you need to embrace change if the alternative is disaster.
3297.author: Elon Musk

3298.quote: Very often a change of self is needed more than a change of scene.
3298.author: A. C. Benson

3299.quote: I hope everyone that is reading this is having a really good day. And if you are not, just know that in every new minute that passes you have an opportunity to change that.
3299.author: Gillian Anderson

3300.quote: Sometimes it's the smallest decisions that can change your life forever.
3300.author: Keri Russell

3301.quote: Just when I think I have learned the way to live, life changes.
3301.author: Hugh Prather

3302.quote: The first step toward change is awareness. The second step is acceptance.
3302.author: Nathaniel Branden

3303.quote: Miracles happen everyday, change your perception of what a miracle is and you'll see them all around you.
3303.author: Jon Bon Jovi

3304.quote: If we don't change, we don't grow. If we don't grow, we aren't really living.
3304.author: Gail Sheehy

3306.quote: There is nothing so stable as change.
3306.author: Bob Dylan

3307.quote: Change your opinions, keep to your principles; change your leaves, keep intact your roots.
3307.author: Victor Hugo

3308.quote: The more things change, the more they are the same.
3308.author: Alphonse Karr

3310.quote: Only the wisest and stupidest of men never change.
3310.author: Confucius

3311.quote: Things don't have to change the world to be important.
3311.author: Steve Jobs

3312.quote: I have noticed even people who claim everything is predestined, and that we can do nothing to change it, look before they cross the road.
3312.author: Stephen Hawking

3313.quote: We cannot change anything until we accept it. Condemnation does not liberate, it oppresses.
3313.author: Carl Jung

3314.quote: God grant me the serenity to accept the things I cannot change, the courage to change the things I can, and the wisdom to know the difference.
3314.author: Reinhold Niebuhr

3315.quote: Lord, where we are wrong, make us willing to change; where we are right, make us easy to live with.
3315.author: Peter Marshall

3316.quote: Things do not change; we change.
3316.author: Henry David Thoreau

3317.quote: We must all obey the great law of change. It is the most powerful law of nature.
3317.author: Edmund Burke

3318.quote: Money and success don't change people; they merely amplify what is already there.
3318.author: Will Smith

3319.quote: I can't really change my life to accommodate people who are jealous. I don't see why I should.
3319.author: Sting

3320.quote: For changes to be of any true value, they've got to be lasting and consistent.
3320.author: Tony Robbins

3321.quote: One of my favorite philosophical tenets is that people will agree with you only if they already agree with you. You do not change people's minds.
3321.author: Frank Zappa

3322.quote: I'm not going to change the way I look or the way I feel to conform to anything. I've always been a freak. So I've been a freak all my life and I have to live with that, you know. I'm one of those people.
3322.author: John Lennon

3323.quote: Ignorance is always afraid of change.
3323.author: Jawaharlal Nehru

3324.quote: Future shock is the shattering stress and disorientation that we induce in individuals by subjecting them to too much change in too short a time.
3324.author: Alvin Toffler

3325.quote: When you are through changing, you are through.
3325.author: Bruce Barton

3326.quote: A small group of thoughtful people could change the world. Indeed, it's the only thing that ever has.
3326.author: Margaret Mead

3327.quote: Change will never happen when people lack the ability and courage to see themselves for who they are.
3327.author: Bryant H. McGill

3328.quote: There are two kinds of fools: those who can't change their opinions and those who won't.
3328.author: Josh Billings

3329.quote: I cannot say whether things will get better if we change; what I can say is they must change if they are to get better.
3329.author: Georg C. Lichtenberg

3330.quote: Change, like sunshine, can be a friend or a foe, a blessing or a curse, a dawn or a dusk.
3330.author: William Arthur Ward

3331.quote: I read and walked for miles at night along the beach, writing bad blank verse and searching endlessly for someone wonderful who would step out of the darkness and change my life. It never crossed my mind that that person could be me.
3331.author: Anna Quindlen

3332.quote: I shall not change my course because those who assume to be better than I desire it.
3332.author: Victoria Woodhull

3333.quote: A fanatic is one who can't change his mind and won't change the subject.
3333.author: Winston Churchill

3334.quote: Opinions are made to be changed - or how is truth to be got at?
3334.author: Lord Byron

3335.quote: I'm a catalyst for change. You can't be an outsider and be successful over 30 years without leaving a certain amount of scar tissue around the place.
3335.author: Rupert Murdoch

3336.quote: Perfection is immutable. But for things imperfect, change is the way to perfect them.
3336.author: Owen Feltham

3337.quote: The main dangers in this life are the people who want to change everything... or nothing.
3337.author: Nancy Astor

3338.quote: It may be hard for an egg to turn into a bird: it would be a jolly sight harder for it to learn to fly while remaining an egg. We are like eggs at present. And you cannot go on indefinitely being just an ordinary, decent egg. We must be hatched or go bad.
3338.author: C. S. Lewis

3339.quote: There are good and bad times, but our mood changes more often than our fortune.
3339.author: Thomas Carlyle

3340.quote: The curious paradox is that when I accept myself just as I am, then I can change.
3340.author: Carl Rogers

3341.quote: If there is anything that we wish to change in the child, we should first examine it and see whether it is not something that could better be changed in ourselves.
3341.author: Carl Jung

3342.quote: We live in a moment of history where change is so speeded up that we begin to see the present only when it is already disappearing.
3342.author: R. D. Laing

3343.quote: My friends, love is better than anger. Hope is better than fear. Optimism is better than despair. So let us be loving, hopeful and optimistic. And we'll change the world.
3343.author: Jack Layton

3345.quote: The world changes in direct proportion to the number of people willing to be honest about their lives.
3345.author: Armistead Maupin

3346.quote: He who is fixed to a star does not change his mind.
3346.author: Leonardo da Vinci

3347.quote: Change means that what was before wasn't perfect. People want things to be better.
3347.author: Esther Dyson

3348.quote: A lot of people get impatient with the pace of change.
3348.author: James Levine

3349.quote: All great change in America begins at the dinner table.
3349.author: Ronald Reagan

3350.quote: Most people already know what they're doing wrong. When I get them to church I want to tell them that you can change.
3350.author: Joel Osteen

3351.quote: Loss is nothing else but change, and change is Nature's delight.
3351.author: Marcus Aurelius

3352.quote: In a progressive country change is constant; change is inevitable.
3352.author: Benjamin Disraeli

3353.quote: Progress is a nice word. But change is its motivator. And change has its enemies.
3353.author: Robert Kennedy

3354.quote: If you want to change attitudes, start with a change in behavior.
3354.author: William Glasser

3355.quote: The garden is growth and change and that means loss as well as constant new treasures to make up for a few disasters.
3355.author: May Sarton

3356.quote: Life belongs to the living, and he who lives must be prepared for changes.
3356.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

3357.quote: Change is inevitable. Change is constant.
3357.author: Benjamin Disraeli

3358.quote: In order to change the world, you have to get your head together first.
3358.author: Jimi Hendrix

3359.quote: What's dangerous is not to evolve.
3359.author: Jeff Bezos

3360.quote: The thing that lies at the foundation of positive change, the way I see it, is service to a fellow human being.
3360.author: Lech Walesa

3361.quote: We all have big changes in our lives that are more or less a second chance.
3361.author: Harrison Ford

3362.quote: The changes in our life must come from the impossibility to live otherwise than according to the demands of our conscience not from our mental resolution to try a new form of life.
3362.author: Leo Tolstoy

3363.quote: Change the changeable, accept the unchangeable, and remove yourself from the unacceptable.
3363.author: Denis Waitley

3365.quote: The world hates change, yet it is the only thing that has brought progress.
3365.author: Charles Kettering

3366.quote: Our dilemma is that we hate change and love it at the same time; what we really want is for things to remain the same but get better.
3366.author: Sydney J. Harris

3367.quote: Without change, something sleeps inside us, and seldom awakens. The sleeper must awaken.
3367.author: Frank Herbert

3368.quote: Any change, even a change for the better, is always accompanied by drawbacks and discomforts.
3368.author: Arnold Bennett

3369.quote: Action and reaction, ebb and flow, trial and error, change - this is the rhythm of living. Out of our over-confidence, fear; out of our fear, clearer vision, fresh hope. And out of hope, progress.
3369.author: Bruce Barton

3370.quote: Could we change our attitude, we should not only see life differently, but life itself would come to be different.
3370.author: Katherine Mansfield

3371.quote: Face the facts of being what you are, for that is what changes what you are.
3371.author: Soren Kierkegaard

3372.quote: People are always looking for the single magic bullet that will totally change everything. There is no single magic bullet.
3372.author: Temple Grandin

3373.quote: When you blame others, you give up your power to change.
3373.author: Robert Anthony

3374.quote: Excuses change nothing, but make everyone feel better.
3374.author: Mason Cooley

3375.quote: The world is changing very fast. Big will not beat small anymore. It will be the fast beating the slow.
3375.author: Rupert Murdoch

3376.quote: Relentless, repetitive self talk is what changes our self-image.
3376.author: Denis Waitley

3377.quote: All change is not growth, as all movement is not forward.
3377.author: Ellen Glasgow

3378.quote: Just because everything is different doesn't mean anything has changed.
3378.author: Irene Peter

3379.quote: They must often change, who would be constant in happiness or wisdom.
3379.author: Confucius

3380.quote: Change in all things is sweet.
3380.author: Aristotle

3381.quote: To change ones life: Start immediately. Do it flamboyantly.
3381.author: William James

3382.quote: A hero is someone right who doesn't change.
3382.author: George Foreman

3383.quote: Because things are the way they are, things will not stay the way they are.
3383.author: Bertolt Brecht

3384.quote: Life is about not knowing, having to change, taking the moment and making the best of it, without knowing what's going to happen next.
3384.author: Gilda Radner

3385.quote: All changes, even the most longed for, have their melancholy; for what we leave behind us is a part of ourselves; we must die to one life before we can enter another.
3385.author: Anatole France

3386.quote: When you jump for joy, beware that no one moves the ground from beneath your feet.
3386.author: Stanislaw Jerzy Lec

3387.quote: You're only as young as the last time you changed your mind.
3387.author: Timothy Leary

3388.quote: He who rejects change is the architect of decay. The only human institution which rejects progress is the cemetery.
3388.author: Harold Wilson

3389.quote: All things must change to something new, to something strange.
3389.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

3390.quote: Anyone who thinks there's safety in numbers hasn't looked at the stock market pages.
3390.author: Irene Peter

3391.quote: It's the most unhappy people who most fear change.
3391.author: Mignon McLaughlin

3392.quote: If you feel like it's difficult to change, you will probably have a harder time succeeding.
3392.author: Andrea Jung

3393.quote: Change occurs in direct proportion to dissatisfaction, but dissatisfaction never changes.
3393.author: Douglas Horton

3394.quote: If you want to make enemies, try to change something.
3394.author: Woodrow Wilson

3395.quote: To change what you get you must change who you are.
3395.author: Vernon Howard

3396.quote: One must change one's tactics every ten years if one wishes to maintain one's superiority.
3396.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

3398.quote: Change is tough, people don't like it, but it is necessary. Take two aspirins and call me in the morning.
3398.author: Christopher Bond

3399.quote: In times of rapid change, experience could be your worst enemy.
3399.author: J. Paul Getty

3400.quote: Change is not only likely, it's inevitable.
3400.author: Barbara Sher

3401.quote: One change always leaves the way open for the establishment of others.
3401.author: Niccolo Machiavelli

3402.quote: As with anything creative, change is inevitable.
3402.author: Enya

3403.quote: Change alone is eternal, perpetual, immortal.
3403.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

3404.quote: Without accepting the fact that everything changes, we cannot find perfect composure. But unfortunately, although it is true, it is difficult for us to accept it. Because we cannot accept the truth of transience, we suffer.
3404.author: Shunryu Suzuki

3405.quote: Sometimes if you want to see a change for the better, you have to take things into your own hands.
3405.author: Clint Eastwood

3406.quote: The truth does not change according to our ability to stomach it.
3406.author: Flannery O'Connor

3407.quote: Let the great world spin for ever down the ringing grooves of change.
3407.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

3408.quote: Things alter for the worse spontaneously, if they be not altered for the better designedly.
3408.author: Francis Bacon

3409.quote: True change takes place in the imagination.
3409.author: Unknown

3410.quote: When it becomes more difficult to suffer than to change... you will change.
3410.author: Robert Anthony

3411.quote: Change is inevitable. Change for the better is a full-time job.
3411.author: Adlai E. Stevenson

3412.quote: All I want to do is change the world.
3412.author: W. Clement Stone

3414.quote: Serve the dinner backward, do anything - but for goodness sake, do something weird.
3414.author: Elsa Maxwell

3415.quote: I don't know if you can change things, but it's a drop in the ocean.
3415.author: Julie Walters

3416.quote: Illness strikes men when they are exposed to change.
3416.author: Herodotus

3417.quote: If you can change three lives in 10, three lives in a hundred, that's got to be good, hasn't it?
3417.author: Ian Botham

3418.quote: In not my, but our collective hands, is held the promise of change.
3418.author: Mark Sanford

3419.quote: The moral world is as little exempt as the physical world from the law of ceaseless change, of perpetual flux.
3419.author: James G. Frazer

3420.quote: To change a habit, make a conscious decision, then act out the new behavior.
3420.author: Maxwell Maltz

3421.quote: Change is the only constant. Hanging on is the only sin.
3421.author: Denise McCluggage

3422.quote: Everything in life that we really accept undergoes a change.
3422.author: Katherine Mansfield

3423.quote: Things of this world are in so constant a flux, that nothing remains long in the same state.
3423.author: John Locke

3424.quote: The foolish and the dead alone never change their opinions.
3424.author: James Russell Lowell

3425.quote: If you want to change the culture, you will have to start by changing the organization.
3425.author: Mary Douglas

3426.quote: Weep not that the world changes - did it keep a stable, changeless state, it were cause indeed to weep.
3426.author: William C. Bryant

3427.quote: Christians are supposed not merely to endure change, nor even to profit by it, but to cause it.
3427.author: Harry Emerson Fosdick

3428.quote: Slowness to change usually means fear of the new.
3428.author: Phil Crosby

3429.quote: Not only is women's work never done, the definition keeps changing.
3429.author: Bill Copeland

3430.quote: He that will not apply new remedies must expect new evils; for time is the greatest innovator.
3430.author: Francis Bacon

3431.quote: What we call progress is the exchange of one nuisance for another nuisance.
3431.author: Havelock Ellis

3432.quote: We emphasize that we believe in change because we were born of it, we have lived by it, we prospered and grew great by it. So the status quo has never been our god, and we ask no one else to bow down before it.
3432.author: Carl T. Rowan

3433.quote: I think you should always bear in mind that entropy is not on your side.
3433.author: Elon Musk

3434.quote: Remember that life's big changes rarely give advance warning.
3434.author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

3435.quote: Taste may change, but inclination never.
3435.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

3436.quote: I believe that history has shape, order, and meaning; that exceptional men, as much as economic forces, produce change; and that passe abstractions like beauty, nobility, and greatness have a shifting but continuing validity.
3436.author: Camille Paglia

3437.quote: I try to contrast; life today is full of contrast... We have to change.
3437.author: Gianni Versace

3438.quote: Our fathers valued change for the sake of its results; we value it in the act.
3438.author: Alice Meynell

3439.quote: Change your thoughts and you change your world.
3439.author: Norman Vincent Peale

3440.quote: Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.
3440.author: Nelson Mandela

3441.quote: I can't change the direction of the wind, but I can adjust my sails to always reach my destination.
3441.author: Jimmy Dean

3442.quote: Gratitude can transform common days into thanksgivings, turn routine jobs into joy, and change ordinary opportunities into blessings.
3442.author: William Arthur Ward

3443.quote: Every great dream begins with a dreamer. Always remember, you have within you the strength, the patience, and the passion to reach for the stars to change the world.
3443.author: Harriet Tubman

3444.quote: No one wants to die. Even people who want to go to heaven don't want to die to get there. And yet death is the destination we all share. No one has ever escaped it. And that is as it should be, because Death is very likely the single best invention of Life. It is Life's change agent. It clears out the old to make way for the new.
3444.author: Steve Jobs

3445.quote: Saving our planet, lifting people out of poverty, advancing economic growth... these are one and the same fight. We must connect the dots between climate change, water scarcity, energy shortages, global health, food security and women's empowerment. Solutions to one problem must be solutions for all.
3445.author: Ban Ki-moon

3446.quote: Always Do Your Best. Your best is going to change from moment to moment; it will be different when you are healthy as opposed to sick. Under any circumstance, simply do your best, and you will avoid self-judgment, self-abuse and regret.
3446.author: Don Miguel Ruiz

3447.quote: The only person who is educated is the one who has learned how to learn and change.
3447.author: Carl Rogers

3448.quote: Forgiving does not erase the bitter past. A healed memory is not a deleted memory. Instead, forgiving what we cannot forget creates a new way to remember. We change the memory of our past into a hope for our future.
3448.author: Lewis B. Smedes

3449.quote: No matter what people tell you, words and ideas can change the world.
3449.author: Robin Williams

3450.quote: Without change there is no innovation, creativity, or incentive for improvement. Those who initiate change will have a better opportunity to manage the change that is inevitable.
3450.author: William Pollard

3451.quote: Few will have the greatness to bend history itself; but each of us can work to change a small portion of events, and in the total; of all those acts will be written the history of this generation.
3451.author: Robert Kennedy

3452.quote: My theory on life is that life is beautiful. Life doesn't change. You have a day, and a night, and a month, and a year. We people change - we can be miserable or we can be happy. It's what you make of your life.
3452.author: Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum

3453.quote: Let us remember: One book, one pen, one child, and one teacher can change the world.
3453.author: Malala Yousafzai

3454.quote: I'm saying to be a hero is means you step across the line and are willing to make a sacrifice, so heroes always are making a sacrifice. Heroes always take a risk. Heroes always deviant. Heroes always doing something that most people don't and we want to change - I want to democratise heroism to say any of us can be a hero.
3454.author: Philip Zimbardo

3455.quote: Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed citizens can change the world; indeed, it's the only thing that ever has.
3455.author: Margaret Mead

3456.quote: Climate change is happening, humans are causing it, and I think this is perhaps the most serious environmental issue facing us.
3456.author: Bill Nye

3457.quote: When all the world appears to be in a tumult, and nature itself is feeling the assault of climate change, the seasons retain their essential rhythm. Yes, fall gives us a premonition of winter, but then, winter, will be forced to relent, once again, to the new beginnings of soft greens, longer light, and the sweet air of spring.
3457.author: Madeleine M. Kunin

3458.quote: The most difficult thing is the decision to act, the rest is merely tenacity. The fears are paper tigers. You can do anything you decide to do. You can act to change and control your life; and the procedure, the process is its own reward.
3458.author: Amelia Earhart

3459.quote: Prayer does not change God, but it changes him who prays.
3459.author: Soren Kierkegaard

3460.quote: We cannot change our past. We can not change the fact that people act in a certain way. We can not change the inevitable. The only thing we can do is play on the one string we have, and that is our attitude.
3460.author: Charles R. Swindoll

3461.quote: Only I can change my life. No one can do it for me.
3461.author: Carol Burnett

3462.quote: When you forgive, you in no way change the past - but you sure do change the future.
3462.author: Bernard Meltzer

3463.quote: So many people live within unhappy circumstances and yet will not take the initiative to change their situation because they are conditioned to a life of security, conformity, and conservation, all of which may appear to give one peace of mind, but in reality, nothing is more damaging to the adventurous spirit.
3463.author: Christopher McCandless

3464.quote: I'm convinced of this: Good done anywhere is good done everywhere. For a change, start by speaking to people rather than walking by them like they're stones that don't matter. As long as you're breathing, it's never too late to do some good.
3464.author: Maya Angelou

3465.quote: Music can change the world because it can change people.
3465.author: Bono

3466.quote: Failure is not fatal, but failure to change might be.
3466.author: John Wooden

3467.quote: On climate change, we often don't fully appreciate that it is a problem. We think it is a problem waiting to happen.
3467.author: Kofi Annan

3468.quote: Time changes everything except something within us which is always surprised by change.
3468.author: Thomas Hardy

3469.quote: My style is definitely schizophrenic; it does change from day to day a lot. It depends on my mood: sometimes I'll be going through a girly, childlike stage and wear a pretty lace dress with a bow in my hair. Then sometimes I'll be moody and just wear black.
3469.author: Amber Le Bon

3470.quote: The 'self-image' is the key to human personality and human behavior. Change the self image and you change the personality and the behavior.
3470.author: Maxwell Maltz

3471.quote: There are three constants in life... change, choice and principles.
3471.author: Stephen Covey

3472.quote: If you don't like how things are, change it! You're not a tree.
3472.author: Jim Rohn

3473.quote: We are all born with a unique genetic blueprint, which lays out the basic characteristics of our personality as well as our physical health and appearance... And yet, we all know that life experiences do change us.
3473.author: Joan D. Vinge

3474.quote: Vision without action is merely a dream. Action without vision just passes the time. Vision with action can change the world.
3474.author: Joel A. Barker

3475.quote: It's coming home to roost over the next 50 years or so. It's not just climate change; it's sheer space, places to grow food for this enormous horde. Either we limit our population growth or the natural world will do it for us, and the natural world is doing it for us right now.
3475.author: David Attenborough

3476.quote: If the facts don't fit the theory, change the facts.
3476.author: Albert Einstein

3477.quote: The pessimist complains about the wind; the optimist expects it to change; the realist adjusts the sails.
3477.author: William Arthur Ward

3478.quote: If you accept the expectations of others, especially negative ones, then you never will change the outcome.
3478.author: Michael Jordan

3479.quote: If I want to knock a story off the front page, I just change my hairstyle.
3479.author: Hillary Clinton

3480.quote: Times and conditions change so rapidly that we must keep our aim constantly focused on the future.
3480.author: Walt Disney

3481.quote: There's almost no food that isn't genetically modified. Genetic modification is the basis of all evolution. Things change because our planet is subjected to a lot of radiation, which causes DNA damage, which gets repaired, but results in mutations, which create a ready mixture of plants that people can choose from to improve agriculture.
3481.author: Nina Fedoroff

3482.quote: It is often when night looks darkest, it is often before the fever breaks that one senses the gathering momentum for change, when one feels that resurrection of hope in the midst of despair and apathy.
3482.author: Hillary Clinton

3483.quote: Intelligence is the ability to adapt to change.
3483.author: Stephen Hawking

3484.quote: The whole course of human history may depend on a change of heart in one solitary and even humble individual - for it is in the solitary mind and soul of the individual that the battle between good and evil is waged and ultimately won or lost.
3484.author: M. Scott Peck

3485.quote: Wherever you are, be there totally. If you find your here and now intolerable and it makes you unhappy, you have three options: remove yourself from the situation, change it, or accept it totally. If you want to take responsibility for your life, you must choose one of those three options, and you must choose now. Then accept the consequences.
3485.author: Eckhart Tolle

3486.quote: Teachers can change lives with just the right mix of chalk and challenges.
3486.author: Joyce Meyer

3487.quote: The most important thing about global warming is this. Whether humans are responsible for the bulk of climate change is going to be left to the scientists, but it's all of our responsibility to leave this planet in better shape for the future generations than we found it.
3487.author: Mike Huckabee

3488.quote: Negative emotions like loneliness, envy, and guilt have an important role to play in a happy life; they're big, flashing signs that something needs to change.
3488.author: Gretchen Rubin

3489.quote: I feel confident imposing change on myself. It's a lot more fun progressing than looking back. That's why I need to throw curve balls.
3489.author: David Bowie

3490.quote: The good and bad things are what form us as people... change makes us grow.
3490.author: Kate Winslet

3491.quote: You collect people to take with you. Some people change, other people don't... it's wonderful because I've met some incredible friends.
3491.author: Imogen Poots

3492.quote: Climate change is destroying our path to sustainability. Ours is a world of looming challenges and increasingly limited resources. Sustainable development offers the best chance to adjust our course.
3492.author: Ban Ki-moon

3493.quote: Climate change does not respect border; it does not respect who you are - rich and poor, small and big. Therefore, this is what we call 'global challenges,' which require global solidarity.
3493.author: Ban Ki-moon

3494.quote: Excellent firms don't believe in excellence - only in constant improvement and constant change.
3494.author: Tom Peters

3495.quote: There is no question that climate change is happening; the only arguable point is what part humans are playing in it.
3495.author: David Attenborough

3496.quote: The greatest discovery of all time is that a person can change his future by merely changing his attitude.
3496.author: Oprah Winfrey

3497.quote: I see the world being slowly transformed into a wilderness; I hear the approaching thunder that, one day, will destroy us too. I feel the suffering of millions. And yet, when I look up at the sky, I somehow feel that everything will change for the better, that this cruelty too shall end, that peace and tranquility will return once more.
3497.author: Anne Frank

3498.quote: The question is not whether we are able to change but whether we are changing fast enough.
3498.author: Angela Merkel

3499.quote: What is necessary to change a person is to change his awareness of himself.
3499.author: Abraham Maslow

3500.quote: What I learned in jail is that I can't change. I can't live a different lifestyle - this is it. This is the life that they gave and this is the life that I made.
3500.author: Tupac Shakur

3501.quote: It's a new challenge to see how people can change your look. I like words like transformation, reinvention, and chameleon. Because one word I don't like is predictable.
3501.author: Naomi Campbell

3502.quote: You can't change who you are, but you can change what you have in your head, you can refresh what you're thinking about, you can put some fresh air in your brain.
3502.author: Ernesto Bertarelli

3503.quote: Change comes with both fear and some pain. Those two ingredients create mistrust, misunderstanding and misinformation. Such is the process of democracy.
3503.author: David Mixner

3504.quote: I like to change. A new lamp, a piece of art, can transform a room.
3504.author: Madonna Ciccone

3505.quote: I don't care whether you're driving a hybrid or an SUV. If you're headed for a cliff, you have to change direction. That's what the American people called for in November, and that's what we intend to deliver.
3505.author: Barack Obama

3506.quote: Don't change on me. Don't extort me unless you intend to do it forever.
3506.author: Tupac Shakur

3507.quote: As life runs on, the road grows strange with faces new - and near the end. The milestones into headstones change, Neath every one a friend.
3507.author: James Russell Lowell

3508.quote: Some argue that now isn't the time to push the green agenda - that all efforts should be on preventing a serious recession. That is a false choice. It fails to recognise that climate change and our carbon reliance is part of problem - high fuel prices and food shortages due to poor crop yields compound today's financial difficulties.
3508.author: Lucy Powell

3509.quote: Terrorism is a psychological warfare. Terrorists try to manipulate us and change our behavior by creating fear, uncertainty, and division in society.
3509.author: Patrick J. Kennedy

3510.quote: Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life.
3510.author: Confucius

3511.quote: Individual commitment to a group effort - that is what makes a team work, a company work, a society work, a civilization work.
3511.author: Vince Lombardi

3512.quote: It's like Forrest Gump said, 'Life is like a box of chocolates.' Your career is like a box of chocolates - you never know what you're going to get. But everything you get is going to teach you something along the way and make you the person you are today. That's the exciting part - it's an adventure in itself.
3512.author: Nick Carter

3513.quote: Nothing ever comes to one, that is worth having, except as a result of hard work.
3513.author: Booker T. Washington

3514.quote: The best preparation for good work tomorrow is to do good work today.
3514.author: Elbert Hubbard

3515.quote: The beginning is the most important part of the work.
3515.author: Plato

3516.quote: Nothing will work unless you do.
3516.author: Maya Angelou

3517.quote: There is no substitute for hard work.
3517.author: Thomas A. Edison

3518.quote: Laziness may appear attractive, but work gives satisfaction.
3518.author: Anne Frank

3519.quote: All life demands struggle. Those who have everything given to them become lazy, selfish, and insensitive to the real values of life. The very striving and hard work that we so constantly try to avoid is the major building block in the person we are today.
3519.author: Pope Paul VI

3520.quote: Let the beauty of what you love be what you do.
3520.author: Rumi

3521.quote: The only place success comes before work is in the dictionary.
3521.author: Vince Lombardi

3522.quote: Far and away the best prize that life has to offer is the chance to work hard at work worth doing.
3522.author: Theodore Roosevelt

3523.quote: Everyone has been made for some particular work, and the desire for that work has been put in every heart.
3523.author: Rumi

3524.quote: I put my heart and my soul into my work, and have lost my mind in the process.
3524.author: Vincent Van Gogh

3525.quote: When you form a team, why do you try to form a team? Because teamwork builds trust and trust builds speed.
3525.author: Russel Honore

3526.quote: Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work.
3526.author: Thomas A. Edison

3527.quote: Before you start some work, always ask yourself three questions - Why am I doing it, What the results might be and Will I be successful. Only when you think deeply and find satisfactory answers to these questions, go ahead.
3527.author: Chanakya

3528.quote: Whatever your life's work is, do it well. A man should do his job so well that the living, the dead, and the unborn could do it no better.
3528.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

3530.quote: What you are will show in what you do.
3530.author: Thomas A. Edison

3531.quote: The will to work of everyone in the country is the best guarantee of national survival.
3531.author: Bhumibol Adulyadej

3532.quote: Working hard and working smart sometimes can be two different things.
3532.author: Byron Dorgan

3533.quote: To find out what one is fitted to do, and to secure an opportunity to do it, is the key to happiness.
3533.author: John Dewey

3534.quote: Let us touch the dying, the poor, the lonely and the unwanted according to the graces we have received and let us not be ashamed or slow to do the humble work.
3534.author: Mother Teresa

3535.quote: To find joy in work is to discover the fountain of youth.
3535.author: Pearl S. Buck

3536.quote: There is always the danger that we may just do the work for the sake of the work. This is where the respect and the love and the devotion come in - that we do it to God, to Christ, and that's why we try to do it as beautifully as possible.
3536.author: Mother Teresa

3537.quote: The supreme accomplishment is to blur the line between work and play.
3537.author: Arnold J. Toynbee

3538.quote: Organizing is what you do before you do something, so that when you do it, it is not all mixed up.
3538.author: A. A. Milne

3539.quote: Never continue in a job you don't enjoy. If you're happy in what you're doing, you'll like yourself, you'll have inner peace. And if you have that, along with physical health, you will have had more success than you could possibly have imagined.
3539.author: Johnny Carson

3540.quote: Instead of being critical of people in authority over you and envious of their position, be happy you're not responsible for everything they have to do. Instead of piling on complaints, thank them for what they do. Overwhelm them with encouragement and appreciation!
3540.author: Joyce Meyer

3541.quote: The brain is a wonderful organ; it starts working the moment you get up in the morning and does not stop until you get into the office.
3541.author: Robert Frost

3542.quote: Big jobs usually go to the men who prove their ability to outgrow small ones.
3542.author: Theodore Roosevelt

3543.quote: All labor that uplifts humanity has dignity and importance and should be undertaken with painstaking excellence.
3543.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

3544.quote: And where I excel is ridiculous, sickening, work ethic. You know, while the other guy's sleeping? I'm working.
3544.author: Will Smith

3545.quote: Without work, all life goes rotten. But when work is soulless, life stifles and dies.
3545.author: Albert Camus

3546.quote: By working faithfully eight hours a day you may eventually get to be boss and work twelve hours a day.
3546.author: Robert Frost

3547.quote: All wealth is the product of labor.
3547.author: John Locke

3548.quote: Put off thy cares with thy clothes; so shall thy rest strengthen thy labor, and so thy labor sweeten thy rest.
3548.author: Francis Quarles

3549.quote: People who work together will win, whether it be against complex football defenses, or the problems of modern society.
3549.author: Vince Lombardi

3550.quote: Plans are only good intentions unless they immediately degenerate into hard work.
3550.author: Peter Drucker

3551.quote: Gentleness doesn't get work done unless you happen to be a hen laying eggs.
3551.author: Coco Chanel

3552.quote: Work is the curse of the drinking classes.
3552.author: Oscar Wilde

3553.quote: I think about my work every minute of the day.
3553.author: Jeff Koons

3554.quote: Concentrate on your job and you will forget your other troubles.
3554.author: William Feather

3555.quote: If Botticelli were alive today he'd be working for Vogue.
3555.author: Peter Ustinov

3556.quote: We work to become, not to acquire.
3556.author: Elbert Hubbard

3557.quote: Economics is extremely useful as a form of employment for economists.
3557.author: John Kenneth Galbraith

3558.quote: Work is a prayer. And I start off every morning dedicating it to our Creator.
3558.author: Joseph Murray

3559.quote: Let us realize that: the privilege to work is a gift, the power to work is a blessing, the love of work is success!
3559.author: David O. McKay

3560.quote: Work gives you meaning and purpose and life is empty without it.
3560.author: Stephen Hawking

3561.quote: Inspiration comes of working every day.
3561.author: Charles Baudelaire

3562.quote: Luck is a dividend of sweat. The more you sweat, the luckier you get.
3562.author: Ray Kroc

3563.quote: I know you've heard it a thousand times before. But it's true - hard work pays off. If you want to be good, you have to practice, practice, practice. If you don't love something, then don't do it.
3563.author: Ray Bradbury

3564.quote: A good job is more than just a paycheck. A good job fosters independence and discipline, and contributes to the health of the community. A good job is a means to provide for the health and welfare of your family, to own a home, and save for retirement.
3564.author: James H. Douglas, Jr.

3565.quote: I think the person who takes a job in order to live - that is to say, for the money - has turned himself into a slave.
3565.author: Joseph Campbell

3566.quote: O man you are busy working for the world, and the world is busy trying to turn you out.
3566.author: Abu Bakr

3567.quote: I work 338 days a year, 16 hours a day.
3567.author: Dave Pelzer

3568.quote: As an actor, to have achieved financial stability is amazing. But I always have this weird fear that I'm not going to get any more work; it's about not having enough money.
3568.author: Paul Giamatti

3569.quote: Work is accomplished by those employees who have not yet reached their level of incompetence.
3569.author: Laurence J. Peter

3570.quote: Teaching was the hardest work I had ever done, and it remains the hardest work I have done to date.
3570.author: Ann Richards

3571.quote: When more and more people are thrown out of work, unemployment results.
3571.author: Calvin Coolidge

3572.quote: Married couples who work together to build and maintain a business assume broad responsibilities. Not only is their work important to our local and national economies, but their success is central to the well-being of their families.
3572.author: Melissa Bean

3573.quote: It is the working man who is the happy man. It is the idle man who is the miserable man.
3573.author: Benjamin Franklin

3574.quote: Every man loves what he is good at.
3574.author: Thomas Shadwell

3575.quote: When your work speaks for itself, don't interrupt.
3575.author: Henry J. Kaiser

3576.quote: If you don't want to work you have to work to earn enough money so that you won't have to work.
3576.author: Ogden Nash

3577.quote: Once you start a working on something, don't be afraid of failure and don't abandon it. People who work sincerely are the happiest.
3577.author: Chanakya

3578.quote: The more I want to get something done, the less I call it work.
3578.author: Richard Bach

3579.quote: To fulfill a dream, to be allowed to sweat over lonely labor, to be given a chance to create, is the meat and potatoes of life. The money is the gravy.
3579.author: Bette Davis

3580.quote: To be a poet is a condition, not a profession.
3580.author: Robert Frost

3581.quote: Every noble work is at first impossible.
3581.author: Thomas Carlyle

3584.quote: I never did a day's work in my life. It was all fun.
3584.author: Thomas A. Edison

3585.quote: The reason a lot of people do not recognize opportunity is because it usually goes around wearing overalls looking like hard work.
3585.author: Thomas A. Edison

3586.quote: When a work lifts your spirits and inspires bold and noble thoughts in you, do not look for any other standard to judge by: the work is good, the product of a master craftsman.
3586.author: Jean de la Bruyere

3587.quote: The harder I work, the luckier I get.
3587.author: Samuel Goldwyn

3588.quote: You know, I think the greatest gift in the world is a good employee, you know, or people who can do your work for you and do it well the way you'd like to have it done. And I've always been able to surround myself with really good people.
3588.author: Kenny Rogers

3589.quote: It is only when I am doing my work that I feel truly alive.
3589.author: Federico Fellini

3590.quote: No one can arrive from being talented alone, work transforms talent into genius.
3590.author: Anna Pavlova

3591.quote: The end of labor is to gain leisure.
3591.author: Aristotle

3592.quote: A man's work is nothing but this slow trek to rediscover, through the detours of art, those two or three great and simple images in whose presence his heart first opened.
3592.author: Albert Camus

3593.quote: I have been up against tough competition all my life. I wouldn't know how to get along without it.
3593.author: Walt Disney

3594.quote: Every man's work, whether it be literature, or music or pictures or architecture or anything else, is always a portrait of himself.
3594.author: Samuel Butler

3595.quote: All things are difficult before they are easy.
3595.author: Thomas Fuller

3596.quote: Working hard is very important. You're not going to get anywhere without working extremely hard.
3596.author: George Lucas

3597.quote: Work will win when wishy washy wishing won t.
3597.author: Thomas S. Monson

3598.quote: Ya gots to work with what you gots to work with.
3598.author: Stevie Wonder

3599.quote: We have a system that increasingly taxes work and subsidizes nonwork.
3599.author: Milton Friedman

3600.quote: Luck? I don't know anything about luck. I've never banked on it and I'm afraid of people who do. Luck to me is something else: Hard work - and realizing what is opportunity and what isn't.
3600.author: Lucille Ball

3601.quote: Don't stay in bed, unless you can make money in bed.
3601.author: George Burns

3602.quote: Opportunities are usually disguised as hard work, so most people don't recognize them.
3602.author: Ann Landers

3603.quote: He who seeks rest finds boredom. He who seeks work finds rest.
3603.author: Dylan Thomas

3604.quote: Work, look for peace and calm in work: you will find it nowhere else.
3604.author: Dmitri Mendeleev

3605.quote: Anyone who can walk to the welfare office can walk to work.
3605.author: Al Capp

3606.quote: The taxpayer - that's someone who works for the federal government but doesn't have to take the civil service examination.
3606.author: Ronald Reagan

3607.quote: There is joy in work. There is no happiness except in the realization that we have accomplished something.
3607.author: Henry Ford

3608.quote: I've got a woman's ability to stick to a job and get on with it when everyone else walks off and leaves it.
3608.author: Margaret Thatcher

3609.quote: It can be liberating to get fired because you realize the world doesn't end. There's other ways to make money, better jobs.
3609.author: Ron Livingston

3610.quote: Good things happen to those who hustle.
3610.author: Chuck Noll

3611.quote: Work is a necessary evil to be avoided.
3611.author: Mark Twain

3612.quote: Work is love made visible. And if you cannot work with love but only with distaste, it is better that you should leave your work and sit at the gate of the temple and take alms of those who work with joy.
3612.author: Khalil Gibran

3613.quote: I believe in stopping work and eating lunch.
3613.author: L'Wren Scott

3614.quote: The only thing that overcomes hard luck is hard work.
3614.author: Harry Golden

3615.quote: Big pay and little responsibility are circumstances seldom found together.
3615.author: Napoleon Hill

3616.quote: Life grants nothing to us mortals without hard work.
3616.author: Horace

3617.quote: Be regular and orderly in your life, so that you may be violent and original in your work.
3617.author: Gustave Flaubert

3618.quote: The biggest job we have is to teach a newly hired employee how to fail intelligently. We have to train him to experiment over and over and to keep on trying and failing until he learns what will work.
3618.author: Charles Kettering

3619.quote: When a man tells you that he got rich through hard work, ask him: 'Whose?'
3619.author: Don Marquis

3620.quote: I guess we all like to be recognized not for one piece of fireworks, but for the ledger of our daily work.
3620.author: Neil Armstrong

3621.quote: Hard work spotlights the character of people: some turn up their sleeves, some turn up their noses, and some don't turn up at all.
3621.author: Sam Ewing

3622.quote: Do not hire a man who does your work for money, but him who does it for love of it.
3622.author: Henry David Thoreau

3623.quote: I've learned from experience that if you work harder at it, and apply more energy and time to it, and more consistency, you get a better result. It comes from the work.
3623.author: Louis C. K.

3624.quote: It is an immutable law in business that words are words, explanations are explanations, promises are promises-but only performance is reality.
3624.author: Harold S. Geneen

3625.quote: If you must have motivation, think of your paycheck on Friday.
3625.author: Noel Coward

3626.quote: For me, every day is a new thing. I approach each project with a new insecurity, almost like the first project I ever did. And I get the sweats. I go in and start working, I'm not sure where I'm going. If I knew where I was going I wouldn't do it.
3626.author: Frank Gehry

3627.quote: Be open to the amazing changes which are occurring in the field that interest you.
3627.author: Leigh Steinberg

3628.quote: The pay is good and I can walk to work.
3628.author: John F. Kennedy

3629.quote: Dreaming in public is an important part of our job description, as science writers, but there are bad dreams as well as good dreams. We're dreamers, you see, but we're also realists, of a sort.
3629.author: William Gibson

3630.quote: And if small businesspeople say they made it on their own, all they are saying is that nobody else worked seven days a week in their place. Nobody showed up in their place to open the door at five in the morning. Nobody did their thinking, and worrying, and sweating for them.
3630.author: Paul Ryan

3631.quote: I thought the attractions of being an astronaut were actually, not so much the Moon, but flying in a completely new medium.
3631.author: Neil Armstrong

3632.quote: Nobody ever drowned in his own sweat.
3632.author: Ann Landers

3633.quote: I can't imagine anything more worthwhile than doing what I most love. And they pay me for it.
3633.author: Edgar Winter

3634.quote: Work expands so as to fill the time available for its completion.
3634.author: C. Northcote Parkinson

3635.quote: I have always argued that change becomes stressful and overwhelming only when you've lost any sense of the constancy of your life. You need firm ground to stand on. From there, you can deal with that change.
3635.author: Richard Nelson Bolles

3636.quote: There's something to be said in favor of working in isolation in the real world.
3636.author: A. R. Ammons

3637.quote: My experience has been that work is almost the best way to pull oneself out of the depths.
3637.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

3638.quote: Unemployment is capitalism's way of getting you to plant a garden.
3638.author: Orson Scott Card

3639.quote: Work is much more fun than fun.
3639.author: Noel Coward

3640.quote: The only way to enjoy anything in this life is to earn it first.
3640.author: Ginger Rogers

3641.quote: Nothing is work unless you'd rather be doing something else.
3641.author: George Halas

3642.quote: It is your work in life that is the ultimate seduction.
3642.author: Pablo Picasso

3643.quote: Work, apart from devotion or love of God, is helpless and cannot stand alone.
3643.author: Ramakrishna

3644.quote: Work is not man's punishment. It is his reward and his strength and his pleasure.
3644.author: George Sand

3645.quote: There is no disgrace in working. There was no silver spoon around at the time I was born.
3645.author: Anna Held

3646.quote: The harder you work... and visualize something, the luckier you get.
3646.author: Seal

3647.quote: Find a job you like and you add five days to every week.
3647.author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

3649.quote: Being an astronaut is a wonderful career. I feel very privileged. But what I really hope for young people is that they find a career they're passionate about, something that's challenging and worthwhile.
3649.author: Ellen Ochoa

3650.quote: No fine work can be done without concentration and self-sacrifice and toil and doubt.
3650.author: Max Beerbohm

3651.quote: Work isn't to make money; you work to justify life.
3651.author: Marc Chagall

3652.quote: Work is a necessity for man. Man invented the alarm clock.
3652.author: Pablo Picasso

3653.quote: Most people treat the office manual the way they treat a software manual. They never look at it.
3653.author: James Levine

3654.quote: I have found in work that you only get back what you put into it, but it does come back gift-wrapped.
3654.author: Joyce Brothers

3655.quote: And to get real work experience, you need a job, and most jobs will require you to have had either real work experience or a graduate degree.
3655.author: Donald Norman

3656.quote: Men for the sake of getting a living forget to live.
3656.author: Margaret Fuller

3658.quote: One man's wage increase is another man's price increase.
3658.author: Harold Wilson

3659.quote: The idea of having a steady job is appealing.
3659.author: Robin Williams

3660.quote: A manager is responsible for the application and performance of knowledge.
3660.author: Peter Drucker

3661.quote: By the work one knows the workman.
3661.author: Jean de La Fontaine

3662.quote: Going to work for a large company is like getting on a train. Are you going sixty miles an hour or is the train going sixty miles an hour and you're just sitting still?
3662.author: J. Paul Getty

3663.quote: Give yourself something to work toward - constantly.
3663.author: Mary Kay Ash

3664.quote: The greatest teacher I know is the job itself.
3664.author: James Cash Penney

3665.quote: Work hard for what you want because it won't come to you without a fight. You have to be strong and courageous and know that you can do anything you put your mind to. If somebody puts you down or criticizes you, just keep on believing in yourself and turn it into something positive.
3665.author: Leah LaBelle

3666.quote: A dream doesn't become reality through magic; it takes sweat, determination and hard work.
3666.author: Colin Powell

3667.quote: The price of success is hard work, dedication to the job at hand, and the determination that whether we win or lose, we have applied the best of ourselves to the task at hand.
3667.author: Vince Lombardi

3668.quote: Your work is going to fill a large part of your life, and the only way to be truly satisfied is to do what you believe is great work. And the only way to do great work is to love what you do. If you haven't found it yet, keep looking. Don't settle. As with all matters of the heart, you'll know when you find it.
3668.author: Steve Jobs

3669.quote: A birthday is just another day where you go to work and people give you love. Age is just a state of mind, and you are as old as you think you are. You have to count your blessings and be happy.
3669.author: Abhishek Bachchan

3670.quote: Success is the result of perfection, hard work, learning from failure, loyalty, and persistence.
3670.author: Colin Powell

3671.quote: We need more good jobs that reward hard work with rising wages, dignity, and a ladder to a better life.
3671.author: Hillary Clinton

3672.quote: Look at the sky. We are not alone. The whole universe is friendly to us and conspires only to give the best to those who dream and work.
3672.author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

3673.quote: The road to success is not easy to navigate, but with hard work, drive and passion, it's possible to achieve the American dream.
3673.author: Tommy Hilfiger

3674.quote: Success is no accident. It is hard work, perseverance, learning, studying, sacrifice and most of all, love of what you are doing or learning to do.
3674.author: Pele

3675.quote: There are no secrets to success. It is the result of preparation, hard work, and learning from failure.
3675.author: Colin Powell

3676.quote: The greatest thing about where my life is right now is it's very relaxed and chill. I'm just hanging out, being myself and doing my work.
3676.author: Lucas Grabeel

3677.quote: To be a champion, I think you have to see the big picture. It's not about winning and losing; it's about every day hard work and about thriving on a challenge. It's about embracing the pain that you'll experience at the end of a race and not being afraid. I think people think too hard and get afraid of a certain challenge.
3677.author: Summer Sanders

3678.quote: Keep your dreams alive. Understand to achieve anything requires faith and belief in yourself, vision, hard work, determination, and dedication. Remember all things are possible for those who believe.
3678.author: Gail Devers

3679.quote: We are all born ignorant, but one must work hard to remain stupid.
3679.author: Benjamin Franklin

3680.quote: When love and skill work together, expect a masterpiece.
3680.author: John Ruskin

3681.quote: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
3681.author: Thomas A. Edison

3682.quote: A gentle word, a kind look, a good-natured smile can work wonders and accomplish miracles.
3682.author: William Hazlitt

3683.quote: Stay true to yourself, yet always be open to learn. Work hard, and never give up on your dreams, even when nobody else believes they can come true but you. These are not cliches but real tools you need no matter what you do in life to stay focused on your path.
3683.author: Phillip Sweet

3684.quote: A leader is best when people barely know he exists, when his work is done, his aim fulfilled, they will say: we did it ourselves.
3684.author: Lao Tzu

3685.quote: We are at our very best, and we are happiest, when we are fully engaged in work we enjoy on the journey toward the goal we've established for ourselves. It gives meaning to our time off and comfort to our sleep. It makes everything else in life so wonderful, so worthwhile.
3685.author: Earl Nightingale

3686.quote: Change does not roll in on the wheels of inevitability, but comes through continuous struggle. And so we must straighten our backs and work for our freedom. A man can't ride you unless your back is bent.
3686.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

3687.quote: Work like you don't need the money. Love like you've never been hurt. Dance like nobody's watching.
3687.author: Satchel Paige

3688.quote: Few will have the greatness to bend history itself; but each of us can work to change a small portion of events, and in the total; of all those acts will be written the history of this generation.
3688.author: Robert Kennedy

3689.quote: Behaving like a princess is work. It's not just about looking beautiful or wearing a crown. It's more about how you are inside.
3689.author: Julie Andrews

3690.quote: To make democracy work, we must be a nation of participants, not simply observers. One who does not vote has no right to complain.
3690.author: Louis L'Amour

3691.quote: Pray as though everything depended on God. Work as though everything depended on you.
3691.author: Saint Augustine

3692.quote: Perseverance is the hard work you do after you get tired of doing the hard work you already did.
3692.author: Newt Gingrich

3693.quote: If you always put limit on everything you do, physical or anything else. It will spread into your work and into your life. There are no limits. There are only plateaus, and you must not stay there, you must go beyond them.
3693.author: Bruce Lee

3694.quote: Being busy does not always mean real work. The object of all work is production or accomplishment and to either of these ends there must be forethought, system, planning, intelligence, and honest purpose, as well as perspiration. Seeming to do is not doing.
3694.author: Thomas A. Edison

3695.quote: Let me define a leader. He must have vision and passion and not be afraid of any problem. Instead, he should know how to defeat it. Most importantly, he must work with integrity.
3695.author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

3696.quote: Everybody wants to be famous, but nobody wants to do the work. I live by that. You grind hard so you can play hard. At the end of the day, you put all the work in, and eventually it'll pay off. It could be in a year, it could be in 30 years. Eventually, your hard work will pay off.
3696.author: Kevin Hart

3697.quote: Without hard work, nothing grows but weeds.
3697.author: Gordon B. Hinckley

3698.quote: Let the future tell the truth, and evaluate each one according to his work and accomplishments. The present is theirs; the future, for which I have really worked, is mine.
3698.author: Nikola Tesla

3699.quote: When I am president, I will work to ensure that all of our kids are treated equally and protected equally. Every action I take, I will ask myself, 'Does this make life better for young Americans in Baltimore, Chicago, Detroit, Ferguson, who have as much of a right to live out their dreams as any other child America?'
3699.author: Donald Trump

3700.quote: Inspiration is one thing and you can't control it, but hard work is what keeps the ship moving. Good luck means, work hard. Keep up the good work.
3700.author: Kevin Eubanks

3701.quote: The miracle is not that we do this work, but that we are happy to do it.
3701.author: Mother Teresa

3702.quote: That's been one of my mantras - focus and simplicity. Simple can be harder than complex: You have to work hard to get your thinking clean to make it simple. But it's worth it in the end because once you get there, you can move mountains.
3702.author: Steve Jobs

3703.quote: Follow your passion, be prepared to work hard and sacrifice, and, above all, don't let anyone limit your dreams.
3703.author: Donovan Bailey

3704.quote: Thinking is the hardest work there is, which is probably the reason why so few engage in it.
3704.author: Henry Ford

3705.quote: You have to fight to reach your dream. You have to sacrifice and work hard for it.
3705.author: Lionel Messi

3706.quote: I learned the value of hard work by working hard.
3706.author: Margaret Mead

3707.quote: Happiness does not come from doing easy work but from the afterglow of satisfaction that comes after the achievement of a difficult task that demanded our best.
3707.author: Theodore Isaac Rubin

3708.quote: Concentrate all your thoughts upon the work at hand. The sun's rays do not burn until brought to a focus.
3708.author: Alexander Graham Bell

3709.quote: If you're trying to achieve, there will be roadblocks. I've had them; everybody has had them. But obstacles don't have to stop you. If you run into a wall, don't turn around and give up. Figure out how to climb it, go through it, or work around it.
3709.author: Michael Jordan

3710.quote: Youth is the gift of nature, but age is a work of art.
3710.author: Stanislaw Jerzy Lec

3711.quote: Work out your own salvation. Do not depend on others.
3711.author: Buddha

3712.quote: Where the spirit does not work with the hand, there is no art.
3712.author: Leonardo da Vinci

3713.quote: Follow your dreams, work hard, practice and persevere. Make sure you eat a variety of foods, get plenty of exercise and maintain a healthy lifestyle.
3713.author: Sasha Cohen

3714.quote: Talent is cheaper than table salt. What separates the talented individual from the successful one is a lot of hard work.
3714.author: Stephen King

3715.quote: Knowledge comes, but wisdom lingers. It may not be difficult to store up in the mind a vast quantity of facts within a comparatively short time, but the ability to form judgments requires the severe discipline of hard work and the tempering heat of experience and maturity.
3715.author: Calvin Coolidge

3716.quote: Pleasure in the job puts perfection in the work.
3716.author: Aristotle

3717.quote: Our work is the presentation of our capabilities.
3717.author: Edward Gibbon

3718.quote: My great hope is to laugh as much as I cry; to get my work done and try to love somebody and have the courage to accept the love in return.
3718.author: Maya Angelou

3719.quote: Never stop fighting until you arrive at your destined place - that is, the unique you. Have an aim in life, continuously acquire knowledge, work hard, and have perseverance to realise the great life.
3719.author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

3720.quote: Football is like life - it requires perseverance, self-denial, hard work, sacrifice, dedication and respect for authority.
3720.author: Vince Lombardi

3721.quote: When you have balance in your life, work becomes an entirely different experience. There is a passion that moves you to a whole new level of fulfillment and gratitude, and that's when you can do your best... for yourself and for others.
3721.author: Cara Delevingne

3722.quote: Decide what you want, decide what you are willing to exchange for it. Establish your priorities and go to work.
3722.author: H. L. Hunt

3723.quote: All growth depends upon activity. There is no development physically or intellectually without effort, and effort means work.
3723.author: Calvin Coolidge

3724.quote: Work hard, stay positive, and get up early. It's the best part of the day.
3724.author: George Allen, Sr.

3725.quote: Teamwork makes the dream work, but a vision becomes a nightmare when the leader has a big dream and a bad team.
3725.author: John C. Maxwell

3726.quote: I believe God is managing affairs and that He doesn't need any advice from me. With God in charge, I believe everything will work out for the best in the end. So what is there to worry about.
3726.author: Henry Ford

3727.quote: Feelings aroused by the touch of someone's hand, the sound of music, the smell of a flower, a beautiful sunset, a work of art, love, laughter, hope and faith - all work on both the unconscious and the conscious aspects of the self, and they have physiological consequences as well.
3727.author: Bernie Siegel

3728.quote: If God can work through me, he can work through anyone.
3728.author: Francis of Assisi

3729.quote: I feel I am lucky. I am grateful for this life that God has given me. I am happy, as I am getting to do work that I want to do and enjoy doing it.
3729.author: Sonam Kapoor

3730.quote: Work hard. And have patience. Because no matter who you are, you're going to get hurt in your career and you have to be patient to get through the injuries.
3730.author: Randy Johnson

3731.quote: My parents survived the Great Depression and brought me up to live within my means, save some for tomorrow, share and don't be greedy, work hard for the necessities in life knowing that money does not make you better or more important than anyone else. So, extravagance has been bred out of my DNA.
3731.author: David Suzuki

3732.quote: Focused, hard work is the real key to success. Keep your eyes on the goal, and just keep taking the next step towards completing it. If you aren't sure which way to do something, do it both ways and see which works better.
3732.author: John Carmack

3733.quote: This has always been a motto of mine: Attempt the impossible in order to improve your work.
3733.author: Bette Davis

3734.quote: If you want to become a great chef, you have to work with great chefs. And that's exactly what I did.
3734.author: Gordon Ramsay

3735.quote: Do not wait; the time will never be 'just right.' Start where you stand, and work with whatever tools you may have at your command, and better tools will be found as you go along.
3735.author: George Herbert

3736.quote: The human foot is a masterpiece of engineering and a work of art.
3736.author: Leonardo da Vinci

3737.quote: Nobody in life gets exactly what they thought they were going to get. But if you work really hard and you're kind, amazing things will happen.
3737.author: Conan O'Brien

3738.quote: One machine can do the work of fifty ordinary men. No machine can do the work of one extraordinary man.
3738.author: Elbert Hubbard

3739.quote: Communication is a skill that you can learn. It's like riding a bicycle or typing. If you're willing to work at it, you can rapidly improve the quality of evry part of your life.
3739.author: Brian Tracy

3740.quote: There may be people who have more talent than you, but there's no excuse for anyone to work harder than you do - and I believe that.
3740.author: Derek Jeter

3741.quote: An organization, no matter how well designed, is only as good as the people who live and work in it.
3741.author: Dee Hock

3742.quote: Persistence and resilience only come from having been given the chance to work though difficult problems.
3742.author: Gever Tulley

3743.quote: I love it when people doubt me. It makes me work harder to prove them wrong.
3743.author: Derek Jeter

3744.quote: A warm smile is the universal language of kindness.
3744.author: William Arthur Ward

3745.quote: We shall never know all the good that a simple smile can do.
3745.author: Mother Teresa

3746.quote: Let my soul smile through my heart and my heart smile through my eyes, that I may scatter rich smiles in sad hearts.
3746.author: Paramahansa Yogananda

3747.quote: Don't cry because it's over. Smile because it happened.
3747.author: Dr. Seuss

3748.quote: A smile is the light in your window that tells others that there is a caring, sharing person inside.
3748.author: Denis Waitley

3749.quote: The real man smiles in trouble, gathers strength from distress, and grows brave by reflection.
3749.author: Thomas Paine

3750.quote: A smile is happiness you'll find right under your nose.
3750.author: Tom Wilson

3751.quote: Too often we underestimate the power of a touch, a smile, a kind word, a listening ear, an honest compliment, or the smallest act of caring, all of which have the potential to turn a life around.
3751.author: Leo Buscaglia

3752.quote: A gentle word, a kind look, a good-natured smile can work wonders and accomplish miracles.
3752.author: William Hazlitt

3754.quote: A smile is a curve that sets everything straight.
3754.author: Phyllis Diller

3755.quote: A kind heart is a fountain of gladness, making everything in its vicinity freshen into smiles.
3755.author: Washington Irving

3756.quote: Smile in the mirror. Do that every morning and you'll start to see a big difference in your life.
3756.author: Yoko Ono

3757.quote: Always keep your smile. That's how I explain my long life.
3757.author: Jeanne Calment

3758.quote: If you smile when no one else is around, you really mean it.
3758.author: Andy Rooney

3759.quote: After every storm the sun will smile; for every problem there is a solution, and the soul's indefeasible duty is to be of good cheer.
3759.author: William R. Alger

3760.quote: Smiling is definitely one of the best beauty remedies. If you have a good sense of humor and a good approach to life, that's beautiful.
3760.author: Rashida Jones

3761.quote: I think that anybody that smiles automatically looks better.
3761.author: Diane Lane

3762.quote: Colors are the smiles of nature.
3762.author: Leigh Hunt

3763.quote: Look back, and smile on perils past.
3763.author: Walter Scott

3764.quote: I'm really exciting. I smile a lot, I win a lot, and I'm really sexy.
3764.author: Serena Williams

3765.quote: Be thou the rainbow in the storms of life. The evening beam that smiles the clouds away, and tints tomorrow with prophetic ray.
3765.author: Lord Byron

3766.quote: Nobody needs a smile so much as the one who has none to give. So get used to smiling heart-warming smiles, and you will spread sunshine in a sometimes dreary world.
3766.author: Lawrence G. Lovasik

3767.quote: Remember even though the outside world might be raining, if you keep on smiling the sun will soon show its face and smile back at you.
3767.author: Anna Lee

3768.quote: I want to touch the heart of the world and make it smile.
3768.author: Charles de Lint

3769.quote: A smile is the universal welcome.
3769.author: Max Eastman

3770.quote: When I look out at the people and they look at me and they're smiling, then I know that I'm loved. That is the time when I have no worries, no problems.
3770.author: Etta James

3771.quote: Never a lip is curved with pain that can't be kissed into smiles again.
3771.author: Bret Harte

3772.quote: Children learn to smile from their parents.
3772.author: Shinichi Suzuki

3773.quote: A smile is the chosen vehicle of all ambiguities.
3773.author: Herman Melville

3774.quote: I was so embarrassed about mispronouncing words. I just knew how to smile.
3774.author: Adriana Lima

3775.quote: If you haven't seen your wife smile at a traffic cop, you haven't seen her smile her prettiest.
3775.author: Kin Hubbard

3776.quote: She gave me a smile I could feel in my hip pocket.
3776.author: Raymond Chandler

3777.quote: What sunshine is to flowers, smiles are to humanity. These are but trifles, to be sure; but scattered along life's pathway, the good they do is inconceivable.
3777.author: Joseph Addison

3778.quote: I never smile unless I mean it.
3778.author: Donny Osmond

3779.quote: Youth smiles without any reason. It is one of its chiefest charms.
3779.author: Thomas Gray

3780.quote: It is impossible to persuade a man who does not disagree, but smiles.
3780.author: Muriel Spark

3781.quote: Better by far you should forget and smile that you should remember and be sad.
3781.author: Christina Rossetti

3782.quote: Courage, not compromise, brings the smile of God's approval.
3782.author: Thomas S. Monson

3783.quote: Wrinkles will only go where the smiles have been.
3783.author: Jimmy Buffett

3784.quote: Wear a smile and have friends; wear a scowl and have wrinkles.
3784.author: George Eliot

3785.quote: If the world's a veil of tears, Smile till rainbows span it.
3785.author: Lucy Larcom

3786.quote: And the smile that is worth the praises of earth is the smile that shines through tears.
3786.author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

3787.quote: The flower in the vase smiles, but no longer laughs.
3787.author: Malcolm de Chazal

3788.quote: The happiness of life is made up of minute fractions - the little, soon forgotten charities of a kiss or a smile, a kind look or heartfelt compliment.
3788.author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

3789.quote: But God can only smile because only God can know what is coming next.
3789.author: Desmond Tutu

3790.quote: I have witnessed the softening of the hardest of hearts by a simple smile.
3790.author: Goldie Hawn

3791.quote: Smile, for everyone lacks self-confidence and more than any other one thing a smile reassures them.
3791.author: Andre Maurois

3792.quote: To smile at the jest which plants a thorn in another's breast is to become a principal in the mischief.
3792.author: Richard Brinsley Sheridan

3793.quote: I have found that a smile and a stick will carry you through all right, and in ninety-nine cases out of a hundred it is the smile that does the trick.
3793.author: Robert Powell

3794.quote: As happy a man as any in the world, for the whole world seems to smile upon me!
3794.author: Samuel Pepys

3795.quote: I've always spent more time with a smile on my face than not, but the thing is, I don't write about it.
3795.author: Robert Smith

3796.quote: A smile abroad is often a scowl at home.
3796.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

3797.quote: They might not need me; but they might. I'll let my head be just in sight; a smile as small as mine might be precisely their necessity.
3797.author: Emily Dickinson

3798.quote: Laughter is day, and sobriety is night; a smile is the twilight that hovers gently between both, more bewitching than either.
3798.author: Henry Ward Beecher

3799.quote: The company of fools may first make us smile, but in the end we always feel melancholy.
3799.author: Oliver Goldsmith

3800.quote: Jesus wept; Voltaire smiled. From that divine tear and from that human smile is derived the grace of present civilization.
3800.author: Victor Hugo

3801.quote: Let us always meet each other with smile, for the smile is the beginning of love.
3801.author: Mother Teresa

3802.quote: Your smile will give you a positive countenance that will make people feel comfortable around you.
3802.author: Les Brown

3803.quote: Beauty is truth's smile when she beholds her own face in a perfect mirror.
3803.author: Rabindranath Tagore

3804.quote: Did I offer peace today? Did I bring a smile to someone's face? Did I say words of healing? Did I let go of my anger and resentment? Did I forgive? Did I love? These are the real questions. I must trust that the little bit of love that I sow now will bear many fruits, here in this world and the life to come.
3804.author: Henri Nouwen

3805.quote: Beauty is power; a smile is its sword.
3805.author: John Ray

3806.quote: The greatest self is a peaceful smile, that always sees the world smiling back.
3806.author: Bryant H. McGill

3808.quote: A woman whose smile is open and whose expression is glad has a kind of beauty no matter what she wears.
3808.author: Anne Roiphe

3809.quote: I love a man with a great sense of humor and who is intelligent - a man who has a great smile. He has to make me laugh. I like a man who is very ambitious and driven and who has a good heart and makes me feel safe.
